content: sometimes power christmas will make do wild wonderful things. do not need believe holy trinity believe positive power doing good others. simple act giving without receiving lost many us these days, worries about money success hold us back from giving others who need. one congregation ohio was moved action by power sermon given at their church christmas eve. pastor at grand lake united methodist church celina, ohio gave an emotional sermon about importance understanding message jesus. many religious people message jesus help others before yourself, make sure people who suffering get help they need enjoy life little bit. sermon was really about generosity what can look like our lives. jesus lived long time ago he acted generously fashion his time - but what would generous act look like our times? was focus sermon. potency sermon was not lost congregation, who were so moved they had take action! after sermon ended, congregation decided take an offering. bowl was passed around room everyone pitched what they could christmas eve words sermon still ringing their ears. what did they do offering? members congregation drove down local waffle house visit ladies working night shift. what great choice most holy days when everyone should their families! ladies working at waffle house clearly were not their families. they had no choice but work holy day because paid bills. congregation understood sacrifice being made by these ladies, wanted help them out. they donated entire offering split amongst ladies at waffle house. total amounted $3,500 being split amongst staff. what beautiful moment! what perfect example what preacher was talking about his sermon! doing good deed like christmas really helped ease burden felt by ladies working at waffle house. sure, they could not see their families, but at least they got little gift from good people their community. perhaps best part about whole event was congregation did not ask anything return. was simple act generosity from people who understood pain being felt by another group sought alleviate some pain. speaks volumes about merits church our daily lives. simple act brought entire community together because showed empathy compassion most special day year.
title: church congregation brings gift waitresses working christmas eve, has them crying (video)

content: when rare shark was caught, scientists were left blundering answers. shark has unique feature. it's not can survive at extreme depths or live an extended period time. shark's unique trait can extend its jaw telescoping fashion beyond its mouth. if you've ever seen hit science fiction movie "alien," shark monster made manifest earth. shark stalks its prey then lashes out its telescoping teeth snatch large fish swallow them one bite. it's deadly predator deep sea. besides its telescoping teeth, shark can glow dark was only recently discovered back 1986. three decades since was first found, just select few exotic shark species have been found. but during routine survey donghe township taiwan, country's fisheries research institute found five these horrifying deep-sea sharks. team was notably horrified described "the most obvious feature needle-shaped teeth, like snake-like fangs. also origin viper shark name." that's right. beast called viper shark. can tell by its name, ferocious its prey. although researchers have gotten their hands few these animals, little known about them. but researchers think these creatures swim between 300-400 meters under surface ocean during day 150 meters below at night. could because temperature changes or something do light? last five specimens were trawled up from depth 350 meters below surface sea. four were already dead. but living specimen was immediately immersed cool seawater. but could not handle sudden change its habitat. perished just day later. while viper sharks look like alien monster from movie, they do not feed humans. their main food sources crustaceans bony fishes. one their favorite lunch items lanternfish. these creatures might attracted toward shark because their glow-in-the-dark bodies. when they swim close enough, shark lashes out its extendable jaw snatches fish up devours whole. first specimens viper shark were found off coast shikoku island japan 1986. bottom-trawler vessel seiryo-maru was first haul these creatures up surface sea. because fish was new discovery at time, it's scientific name honors seiryo-maru captain, hiromichi kabeya. shark's scientific name was trigonognathus kabeyai. although not much about these fish known, scientists classify them dogfish shark. they have only been found deep parts pacific ocean. how would react if shark came up other end your fishing line? would think were having nightmare?
title: elusive 'alien sea ' caught by scientist one first times ever (video)

content: clinton-obama emails: key understanding why hillary wasn't indicted - andrew mccarthy headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! by andrew c. mccarthy / family security matters new fbi texts highlight motive conceal president's involvement. from first, these columns have argued whitewash hillary clinton-emails caper was president barack obama's call - not fbi's, not justice department's. (see, e.g., here, here, here.) decision was inevitable. obama, using pseudonymous email account, had repeatedly communicated secretary clinton over her private, non-secure email account. these emails must have involved some classified information, given nature consultations between presidents secretaries state, broad outlines obama's own executive order defining classified intelligence (see eo 13526, section 1.4), fact obama administration adamantly refused disclose clinton-obama emails. if classified information was mishandled, was necessarily mishandled both ends these email exchanges. if clinton had been charged, obama's culpable involvement would have been patent. any prosecution clinton, clinton-obama emails would have been spotlight. prosecution, they would more proof willful (or, if prefer, grossly negligent) mishandling intelligence. more significantly, clinton's defense, they would show obama was complicit clinton's conduct yet faced no criminal charges. why such an indictment hillary clinton was never going happen. latest jaw-dropping disclosures text messages between fbi agent peter strzok his paramour, fbi lawyer lisa page, illustrate point. moment, i want put aside latest controversy - fbi's failure retain five months text messages between strzok page, those chattiest star-crossed lovers. yes, "glitch" closes our window critical time trump-russia investigation: mid december 2016 through mid may 2017. when bureau justice department were reportedly conducting renewing (in 90-day intervals) court-approved fisa surveillance may well have focused newly sworn-in president united states. (remember: bureau's then-director, james comey, testified at march 20 house intelligence committee hearing investigation was probing possible coordination trump's campaign kremlin interference election.) retention default has been chalked up technological mishap. assuming truly was an indiscriminate, bureau-wide problem - lost texts not limited phones involved trump-russia investigation - hard imagine its going undetected five months an agency whose business information retention. but not inconceivable. attorney general jeff sessions maintains an aggressive inquiry underway, so let's assume (for argument's sake, at least) either texts will recovered or satisfactory explanation their non-retention will forthcoming. now, let's stick clinton-obama emails. only july 5, 2016, comey held press conference at which he delivered statement describing mrs. clinton's criminal conduct but nevertheless recommending against an indictment. we now know comey's remarks had been works two months were revised several times by director his advisers. past weekend, letter fbi regarding missing texts, senate homeland security committee chairman ron johnson (r., wis.) addressed some these revisions. according senator johnson, draft dated <date> (i.e., five days before comey delivered final version), contained passage expressly referring troublesome email exchange between clinton obama. (i note fbi's report its eventual interview clinton contains cryptic reference july 1, 2012, email clinton sent from russia obama's email address. see report, page 2.) passage june 30 draft stated: we also assess secretary clinton's use personal email domain was both known by large number people readily apparent. she also used her personal email extensively while outside united states, including from territory sophisticated adversaries. use included an email exchange president while secretary clinton was territory such an adversary. [emphasis added.] given combination factors, we assess possible hostile actors gained access secretary clinton's personal email account. same day, according strzok-page text, revised draft comey's remarks was circulated by his chief staff, jim rybicki. replaced "the president" "another senior government official." effort obscure obama's involvement had an obvious flaw: would practically have begged congressional investigators enterprising journalists press identification "senior government official" whom clinton had exchanged emails. was not going work. consequently, by time comey delivered his remarks july 5, decision had been made avoid even veiled allusion obama. instead, all stress was placed clinton (who was not going charged anyway) irresponsibly sending receiving sensitive emails were likely have been penetrated by hostile intelligence services. comey made no reference clinton's correspondent: we also assess secretary clinton's use personal e-mail domain was both known by large number people readily apparent. she also used her personal e-mail extensively while outside united states, including sending receiving work-related e-mails territory sophisticated adversaries. [emphasis added.] given combination factors, we assess possible hostile actors gained access secretary clinton's personal e-mail account. decision purge any reference obama consistent panic seized his administration from moment clinton's use private, non-secure server system was revealed early march 2015. i detailed reaction series 2016 columns (see, e.g., here here). what most alarmed obama clinton advisers (those groups overlap) was not only there were several clinton-obama email exchanges, but also obama dissembled about his knowledge clinton's private email use nationally televised interview. march 4, just after new york times broke news about clinton's email practices at state department, john podesta (a top obama adviser clinton's campaign chairman) emailed cheryl mills (clinton's confidant top aide obama state department) suggest clinton's "emails from potus" should "held" - i.e., not disclosed - because "that's heart his exec privilege." at time, house committee investigating benghazi jihadist attack was pressing production clinton's emails. his counselors grappled how address his own involvement clinton's misconduct, obama deceptively told cbs news march 7 interview he had found out about clinton's use personal email conduct state department business "the same time everybody else learned through news reports." perhaps he was confident that, because he had used an alias communicating clinton, his emails from her - estimated number around 20 - would remain undiscovered. his clinton's advisers were not so confident. right after interview aired, clinton campaign secretary josh scherwin emailed jennifer palmieri other senior campaign staffers, stating: "jen probably have more but looks like potus just said he found out hrc was using her personal email when he saw news." scherwin's alert was forwarded mills. shortly afterwards, an agitated mills emailed podesta: "we need clean up - he has emails from her - they do not say state.gov." (that is, obama had emails from clinton, which he had know were from private account since her address did not end "@state.gov" state department emails do.) so how did obama his helpers "clean up"? obama had his email communications clinton sealed. he did by invoking dubious presidential-records privilege. white house insisted matter had nothing do contents emails, course; rather, was intended vindicate principle confidentiality presidential communications close advisers. media content play along, had twofold benefit: obama was able (1) sidestep disclosure without acknowledging emails contained classified information (2) avoid using term "executive privilege" - all its dark watergate connotations - even though was precisely what he was invoking. note claims executive privilege must yield demands disclosure relevant evidence criminal prosecutions. but course, that's not problem if there will no prosecution. white house purported repair president's disingenuous statement cbs interview by rationalizing he had meant he learned clinton's homebrew server system through news reports - he hadn't meant claim unawareness she occasionally used private email. was sheer misdirection: from obama's standpoint, problem was he discussed government intelligence matters secretary state through private email account; fact that, addition, clinton's private email account was connected her own private server system, rather than some other private email service, was beside point. but, again, media was not interested such distinctions contentedly accepted white house's non-explanation. meanwhile, attorney general loretta lynch ordered comey use word "matter" rather than "investigation" describe fbi's probe clinton's email practices. ensured democratic administration's law-enforcement agencies were aligning their story democratic candidate's campaign rhetoric. if there was no investigation, there would no prosecution. april 2016, another nationally televised interview, obama made clear he did not want clinton indicted. his rationale was legally frivolous straw man: clinton had not intended harm national security. was not an element felony offenses she had committed; nor was dispute. no matter: obama's analysis was stated view chief executive. if, was sure happen, his subordinates executive law-enforcement agencies conformed their decisions his stated view, there would no prosecution. within few weeks, even though investigation was ostensibly still underway over dozen key witnesses - content: president trump, right, rep. robert lighthizer ( reuters/jonathan ernst/reuters ) "fake news" now part american vernacular, wordsmiths have donald trump thank. president trump recently handed out 2017 "fake news awards" 11 most irresponsible examples reporting. headlines, ranging from ice cream pecan pie, bordered on--if not crossed--the ridiculous. trump's "favorite" media outlet, cnn, garnered four awards. but long before last week's awards, donald trump was calling out those who just plain didn't get story straight, even campaign trail. his boldness resonated voters, says stephen e. strang, author best-selling book, god donald trump. strang, who was guest fox & friends past sunday, said when then-candidate trump began responding his critics at all hours day night twitter, he surprised embarrassed lot his detractors, tweeting strongly worded comments no one had expected. "he had already waged highly publicized verbal battles meryl streep other celebrities such rosie o'donnell oprah winfrey, but would an altogether different kind war," strang wrote. "with level technical savvy uncommon man his generation, trump was able counterattack within minutes whenever his opponents made scurrilous charges against him. was something new, delighted his fans public at large, even infuriated increasingly volatile resistance. "before long, trump was serial tweeter, he provided media some riveting sound bites," he continued. "not everyone, course, was thrilled by new development. liberal news organizations compiled exhaustive catalogs trump's tweets show how insensitive, ignorant wrong-headed he could be. but they couldn't ignore them, they followed his tweets faithfully, hoping catch him some word or deed would his undoing." advertisement strang fully acknowledges some trump's comments were tactless crude, often attacking his detractors salty schoolyard taunts. "but trump's use twitter gave him way around mainstream media his political opponents who had been getting free access media were able insult demean him impunity," strang wrote. "suddenly, those same people were being held accountable real time, news hawks both sides didn't want miss word it. "trump hasn't slowed his twitter storm since moving into white house," author added. "at one point, he had said there would have been 'zero chance winning wh' if he had relied 'fake news' being churned out by mainstream media. but his candid unfiltered twitter feeds helped turn tables his foes." strang an award-winning journalist successful businessman who began his career newspaper reporter at orlando sentinel. he later founded christian publishing house media company while interviewing writing about nearly every christian leader country over past four decades. more information god donald trump, visit <url> view book's video. visitors site can also download free chapter order book. god donald trump published by frontline, an imprint charisma house, which has published books challenge, encourage, teach equip christians, including 14 new york times best-sellers. connect god deeper way read his word. select bibles now 50% off plus free shipping free gift. show me bibles! encounter holy spirit develop relationship saturates his peace, love joy. explore life spirit series. free gift! download pastor bill johnson's 40-page mini ebook, war your head, unlock your supernatural lifestyle. click here see an error article? send us correction

content: mission must at heart journalism, pope says headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! vatican city, jan 24, 2018 / 04:26 am (cna/ewtn news).- his message world day social communications, published wednesday, pope francis said world lightning-fast communication, there responsibility combat falsehood misinformation truth, treating journalism people-oriented mission. "in today's world, [the work journalists] is, every sense, not just job; mission," pope wrote his message released jan. 24. "amid feeding frenzies mad rush scoop, they must remember heart information not speed which reported or its audience impact, but persons." "informing others means forming others; means being touch people's lives," he continued. "that why ensuring accuracy sources protecting communication real means promoting goodness, generating trust, opening way communion peace." francis' message next world day social communications was released jan. 24, feast day st. francis de sales, patron saint journalists. 52nd annual celebration will take place may 13, 2018, theme: "'the truth will set free' (jn 8:32). fake news journalism peace." "in today's fast-changing world communications digital systems, we witnessing spread what has come known 'fake news,'" pope said. "in way, i would like contribute our shared commitment stemming spread fake news rediscovering dignity journalism personal responsibility journalists communicate truth." best "antidote" spread falsehoods 'fake news' aren't strategies, he stated, but people. "people who not greedy but ready listen, people who make effort engage sincere dialogue so truth can emerge; people who attracted by goodness take responsibility how they use language." everyone has duty counter lies found 'fake news,' he said. but an even weightier responsibility falls upon those whose job provide world information, namely, journalists, "protectors news." francis went encourage everyone promote "a journalism peace," which he said doesn't mean some saccharine or sentimental reporting refuses acknowledge existence real serious problems. rather, he emphasized, journalism peace journalism "truthful opposed falsehoods, rhetorical slogans, sensational headlines. journalism created by people people, one at service all, especially those - they majority our world - who have no voice." journalism, he continued, less focused breaking news, more exploring underlying causes conflicts, so can promote deeper understanding contribute resolutions "by setting place virtuous processes" offering alternatives "shouting matches." first 'fake news,' francis said, was created by "crafty serpent" book genesis, who used falsehood tempt eve into disobeying god. "the strategy skilled 'father lies' (jn 8:44) precisely mimicry, sly dangerous form seduction worms its way into heart false alluring arguments," he said. eve's temptation by serpent "brings light an essential element our reflection: there no such thing harmless disinformation." he pointed out how constant exposure deceptive language can also have harmful consequences our interior life, illustrated by quote from fyodor dostoevsky's brothers karamazov. "people who lie themselves listen their own lie come such pass they cannot distinguish truth within them, or around them, so lose all respect themselves others. having no respect, they cease love, order occupy distract themselves without love they give way passions coarse pleasures, sink bestiality their vices, all from continual lying others themselves." so how do we defend ourselves from evil, francis asked. "the most radical antidote virus falsehood purification by truth," which christianity more than just judgment things true or false, he said. it's also more than just revealing things concealed, he continued: "truth involves our whole life." "truth something can lean on, so not fall," he said. "in relational sense, only truly reliable trustworthy one - one whom we can count - living god. hence, jesus can say: 'i am truth.'" "to end, drawing inspiration from franciscan prayer, we might turn truth person," he concluded, offering following prayer: "lord, make us instruments your peace. help us recognize evil latent communication does not build communion. help us remove venom from our judgements. help us speak about others our brothers sisters. faithful trustworthy; may our words seeds goodness world: where there shouting, let us practice listening; where there confusion, let us inspire harmony; where there ambiguity, let us bring clarity; where there exclusion, let us offer solidarity; where there sensationalism, let us use sobriety; where there superficiality, let us raise real questions; where there prejudice, let us awaken trust; where there hostility, let us bring respect; where there falsehood, let us bring truth. amen." source: <url>
title: mission must at heart journalism, pope says

content: (screenshot: youtube) andrew, luis kevin palau give health update, <date>. kevin, andrew, luis palau all stood together thursday make shocking announcement beloved world-renowned evangelist luis palau was diagnosed stage 4 lung cancer. "we wanted tape video tell whole world love dad work we do what's been going dad's life," kevin, president luis palau ministries, said social media video posted thursday. he then proceeded share his father fell ill after busy fall season, he returned from an overseas trip u.k. they believed he only had chest cold but when didn't go away family convinced luis go doctor. "to our surprise, early report we got just before christmas [said] there was some cancer inside one dad's lungs," kevin explained. they got extra testing done went an oncologist who revealed terminal diagnosis. "just few days ago we got word it's stage 4 lung cancer. that's shock, especially someone who's always been healthy dad," he continued. son said they made video so people can join them prayer. luis then shared his heart concerning everything. "i haven't been hospital one night except when i broke bone back 1984 after missions from london," esteemed argentinian evangelist shared. "to me, first thing do cry. i think 'oh wow, i can gone few months' one silly thought came mind i won't able pick up phone talk boys hear their voice talk my wife," luis emotionally shared. "this sad, i don't feel panic or horror, if [i'm] healed, hallelujah! many people praying lord will do miracle. would take literally miracle medically speaking. stage 4 big time." he went say peace he felt immediately was at least 10 years ago he elected his son, kevin, president ministry andrew an anointed evangelist. "so everything ready if lord wants take me home next two months or two years, then i'm ready," loving father maintained his sons looked at him heartbroken smiles. luis said he's going continue living one day at time despite sad prognosis he still feels good. he shared scripture has been keeping him encouraged: isaiah 41:10, which says, "fear not, i am you; not dismayed, i am your god. i will strengthen help you; i will uphold my victorious righteous right arm." "i know lord me, by holy spirit indwelling, he us, we go through it, we go into presence lord," luis testified. he also shared 2 timothy 4 where apostle paul says, "the time my departure here." 83-year-old began cry he thought about leaving his family but he did say he still intends complete mission trips they have planned throughout world year god gives him strength. "thank your prayers, thank loving us, thank your support," luis said he ended his portion. andrew concluded video by saying he's had many restless nights past couple days. "i got up read my proverbs early couldn't wait come up see your face," he told his dad. he then quoted proverbs 15, which says, "the evidence happy heart cheerful face." "to think you're facing what you're facing day by day we see your happy face, it's proof you're at peace," andrew stated. "we beg pray dad mom," he asked viewers. luis has been ministry more than 50 years. palau association has collaborated thousands churches hundreds cities around world his life point. he's made an impact top global cities: london, hong kong, singapore, chicago, moscow, madrid, mexico city, buenos aires, washington, d.c., more. reporter was attendance 2015 he rallied 1,000 new york city churches together make history big apple. was one biggest evangelical moves new york city approximately 60,000 people gathered hear gospel worship. palau association has coordinated hundreds citywide campaigns just like dozens nations, including major evangelistic festivals all five continents. stay up date luis' condition, go palau.org. watch full family announcement above or spanish facebook here.
title: luis palau diagnosed stage 4 lung cancer
meta_description: kevin, andrew, luis palau all stood together thursday make shocking announcement beloved world-renowned evangelist luis palau was diagnosed stage 4 lung cancer.

content: expand | collapse (photo: reuters/peter macdiarmid) ampoules containing medium stem cell storage file photo. team scientists california have found new way create stem cells doesn't require destruction human embryos. researchers at san francisco-based gladstone institute have announced they were able create stem cells by using skin cells from mice through genome editing tool called crispr. sheng ding, phd, senior investigator at gladstone institute, said statement released monday was an innovative means creating stem cells research. "this new way make induced pluripotent stem cells fundamentally different from how they've been created before," said ding. "at beginning study, we didn't think would work, but we wanted at least try answer question: can reprogram cell just by unlocking specific location genome? answer yes." statement, gladstone institute noted they were building upon findings senior investigator shinya yamanaka, md, phd, who 2006 found "he could make stem cells -- dubbed induced pluripotent stem cells (ipscs) -- by treating ordinary skin cells four key proteins." "ding others previously created ipscs not transcription factors, but by adding cocktail chemicals cells," noted institute. "the latest study, published cell stem cell, offers third way turn skin cells into stem cells by directly manipulating cells' genome using crispr gene regulation techniques." short "clusters regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats," crisprs type dna sequences found bacteria. "crispr technology was adapted from natural defense mechanisms bacteria archaea (the domain single-celled microorganisms). these organisms use crispr-derived rna various cas proteins, including cas9, foil attacks by viruses other foreign bodies," explained live science. "they do so primarily by chopping up destroying dna foreign invader. when these components transferred into other, more complex, organisms, allows manipulation genes, or 'editing.'" gladstone institute's breakthrough stem cell creation comes months after an israeli-based firm developed new als treatment uses cells extracted from bone marrow rather than embryos. brainstorm announced october was beginning clinical treatments united states new treatment, which could help restore motor abilities those als. "during maturation process, cells from bone marrow manipulated into behaving like brain cells, they produce materials building blocks brain," reported jerusalem post. "when these modified cells put back patients, building blocks circulate spinal fluid help repair damaged brain."
title: scientists develop new method create stem cells without killing human embryos
meta_description: team scientists california have found new way create stem cells doesn't require destruction human embryos.

content: subscribe canada free press free supply physicians canada: projections assessment canada has almost 20 per cent fewer doctors per capita than oecd average vancouver--the number doctors canada (per person) lags far behind other developed countries, if current trends continue, canada likely won't close gap coming years, finds new study released today by fraser institute, an independent, non-partisan canadian public policy think-tank. "physicians play crucial role canada's health-care system, but compared other developed countries, canada has low ratio physicians people," said steven globerman, international business professor at western washington university, fraser institute senior fellow co-author supply physicians canada: projections assessment. study finds 2015, canada had just 2.7 doctors per 1,000 people. that's almost 20 per cent lower than 3.4 per 1,000 person average other developed countries organization economic co-operation development (oecd), group developed high-income countries like canada. crucially, projecting number doctors canada into future years--assuming current medical school enrolment foreign-trained doctor trends continue--canada will have 2.97 doctors per 1,000 people by 2030, still well below 2015 oecd average. "unless current trends reversed, an increasing scarcity doctors looms large canada's future," globerman said. "policymakers should think now about how having relatively few doctors will affect canadian patients health-care system more broadly." media contact: bryn weese, media relations specialist, fraser institute, .(javascript must enabled view email address) fraser institute an independent canadian public policy research educational organization offices vancouver, calgary, toronto, montreal ties global network 86 think-tanks. its mission measure, study, communicate impact competitive markets government intervention welfare individuals. protect institute's independence, does not accept grants from governments or contracts research. visit fraserinstitute.org. follow fraser institute twitter | like us facebook please adhere our commenting policy avoid being banned. privately owned website, we reserve right remove any comment ban any user at any time.comments contain spam, advertising, vulgarity, threats violence, racism, anti-semitism, or personal or abusive attacks other users may removed result ban.-- follow these instructions registering

content: black hole pushing stars around globular cluster headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! astronomers have been fascinated globular clusters ever since they were first observed 17th century. these spherical collections stars among oldest known stellar systems universe, dating back early universe when galaxies were just beginning grow evolve. such clusters orbit centers most galaxies, over 150 known belong milky way alone. one these clusters known ngc 3201, cluster located about 16,300 light years away southern constellation vela. using eso's very large telescope (vlt) at paranal observatory chile, team astronomers recently studied cluster noticed something very interesting. according study they released, cluster appears have black hole embedded it. study appeared monthly notices royal astronomical society under title "a detached stellar-mass black hole candidate globular cluster ngc 3201". study was led by benjamin giesers georg-august-university gottingen included members from liverpool john moores university, queen mary university london, leiden observatory, institute astrophysics space sciences, eth zurich, leibniz institute astrophysics potsdam (aip). sake their study, team relied multi unit spectroscopic explorer (muse) instrument vlt observe ngc 3201. instrument unique because way allows astronomers measure motions thousands far away stars simultaneously. course their observations, team found one cluster's stars was being flung around at speeds several hundred kilometers an hour period 167 days. giesers explained an eso press release: "it was orbiting something was completely invisible, which had mass more than four times sun -- could only black hole! first one found globular cluster by directly observing its gravitational pull." finding was rather unexpected, constitutes first time astronomers have been able detect an inactive black hole at heart globular cluster - meaning not currently accreting matter or surrounded by glowing disc gas. they were also able estimate black hole's mass by measuring movements star around thus extrapolating its enormous gravitational pull. from its observed properties, team determined rapidly-moving star about 0.8 times mass our sun mass its black hole counterpart around 4.36 times sun's mass. put's "stellar-mass black hole" category, which stars exceeds maximum mass allowance neutron star, but smaller than supermassive black holes (smbhs) - which exist at centers most galaxies. finding highly significant, not just because was first time astronomers have observed stellar-mass black hole globular cluster. addition, confirms what scientists have been suspecting few years now, thanks recent radio x-ray studies globular clusters detection gravity wave signals. basically, indicates black holes more common globular clusters than previously thought. "until recently, was assumed almost all black holes would disappear from globular clusters after short time systems like should not even exist!" said giesers. "but clearly not case - our discovery first direct detection gravitational effects stellar-mass black hole globular cluster. finding helps understanding formation globular clusters evolution black holes binary systems - vital context understanding gravitational wave sources." find was also significant given relationship between black holes globular clusters remains mysterious, but highly important one. due their high masses, compact volumes, great ages, astronomers believe clusters have produced large number stellar-mass black holes over course universe's history. discovery could therefore tell us much about formation globular clusters, black holes, origins gravitational wave events. sure enjoy eso podcast explaining recent discovery: further reading: eso, mnras post black hole pushing stars around globular cluster appeared first universe today. source: <url>
title: black hole pushing stars around globular cluster

prejudices, at each other's throats. if trade your freedom security, terrorists win. we've walked strange harrowing road since <date>, littered debris our once-vaunted liberties. we have gone from nation took great pride being model representative democracy being model how persuade freedom-loving people march lockstep police state. so doing, we have proven osama bin laden right. he warned "freedom human rights america doomed. u.s. government will lead american people -- west general -- into an unbearable hell choking life." sum things up, destruction began 9/11 terror attacks has expanded into an all-out campaign terror, trauma, acclimation indoctrination aimed at getting americans used life american police state. bogeyman's names faces change over time, but end result remains same: our unquestioning acquiescence anything government wants do exchange phantom promise safety security has transitioned us life society where government agents routinely practice violence citizens while, conjunction corporate state, spying most intimate details our personal lives. lesson learned, i document my book battlefield america: war american people, simply this: once start down road towards police state, will very difficult turn back.
title: france from post-9/11 america: lessons we learned too late
authors: john w. whitehead, because without america, there no free world.

content: one thing research, collate articulate coherent message print, but acid test knowledge orate debate those thoughts front an informed skeptical audience. highlight author's week was being honored guest speaker at my local rotary club. "service above self" motto oldest all service organizations, they have record good deeds support their claim. my luncheon oratory included information global warming issue difficulty presenting information public. latter made far worse by news media has ceased free. i stated problem was scientifically illiterate news directors high school educated talk radio hosts over developed thumbs caller dump button. statement requires clarification. just one generation ago, term 'high school education' would not have been considered demeaning. one generation ago american primary secondary education tested ranked number one world. what had been gold standard knowledge has been quickly substituted federal certificate decline excellence. every child left behind typical result every government involvement last generation outcome based goal which raises none, merely lowers common denominator. poorly educated students go become poor quality workers who make poor life choices. spiral stupidity quickly leads consumption over productivity, speculation over thrift. we may soon have empirical data how long nation can endure imposed ignorance. global warming discussion i displayed two graphs available at 'ice age chart' any search engine. i neglected mention there many conflicting charts at website no disclaimers. display were two charts showing earth temperatures atmospheric carbon dioxide levels across one half billion one half million year time scales. readily apparent, regardless education level, there no correlation between temperature co2. formal education should only beginning never limit personal knowledge. we live an age when world's greatest library website away, world's greatest librarian just search engine click away. but great resource comes 'caveat emptor' or 'buyer beware'. lurking internet shadows those who would beat senseless senseless mann hockey stick graph. researching obvious climate fraud, heavy hand government interventions everywhere. what department education had begun dumb down primary education, national science foundation national academy science have completed at collegiate level. manipulation climate science readily apparent. also apparent geo-nuclear heat mineral flow thru oceans factor climate. disturbing find every web listing ocean currents, temperatures chemistry has odious goreian climate statement human produced co2 destroying ocean balance. same day rotary presentation, october issue my favorite punching bag, rolling stone arrived. spirit "service above self", here's quick review so don't have suffer your own. cover articles "obama fights back" interview matt taibbi article "the truth about tea party" most relevant. oval office interview, by jann wenner appears highly scripted. no doubt pre-submitted questions if not pre-printed reply, then wenner must have missed teleprompter hanging behind his back. chief executive did mention 'we' several times by necessity, but quickly reverted "i did everything" position true narcissist. standard talking points were tea party rubes under unwitting control dick armey freedom works. tea party members 'anti-immigrant' 'opposed by what i represent president' [they're racist] opposed green energy work place safety regulations. obama continues, 'look, president, i swore uphold constitution, part constitution free press', although fox news viewpoint 'destructive country'. rather than admit 'truth' has bearing media success, viewpoints just marketing tool. meanwhile our fearless leader 'had prevent great depression, restore financial system, manage two wars'...liberate health care from doctors student loans health insurance from private sector. he's achieved 70% his goals 40% his first term public option, additional taxes greater control everything enabled awaiting regulatory enforcement. another barack goal was white house basketball goal, now erected existing tennis court. half page photo shows our leader shooting hoops washington monument background. while not busy slam dunking domestic issues savant has 'reset our relations russia', brought peace middle east, ended iraq war restored america's leadership issues like human rights torture world-wide. he can do all while listening 2000 songs he has loaded into his ipod. mr pres agrees nasa wack-job james hanson, climate change comparable slavery faced by lincoln nazism faced by churchill. his nut-case energy secretary, steven chu has claimed painting all roofs highways white would provide temporary solution global warming. surprising, chu was 'unsung hero gulf oil spill...this guy went down helped design way plug hole bp engineers'. finally credit everything given administration. subject command performances came up bob dylan skipping all expected idolatry, singing "the times they changing", dissing photo-ops leaving. opposite occurred at sir paul mccartney concert. discussing beatle singing 'michelle' barack's michelle sends sobbing president from room. matt taibbi article "tea & crackers" had some surprising areas agreement. "this america we have an entrenched oligarchical system place insulates us from any meaningful political change". matt goes detail compromising tea party issues candidates by gop insiders, very real problem all true patriots. matt mentions kentucky senate candidate rand paul possible emerging conflicts then mentions rand's dad, rep ron paul 2008 fringe candidate president. matt confesses while covering paul campaign, he liked ron because "he's honest, anti-war pro-legalization". shocking see liberal reporter agree so many libertarian positions. maybe matt patriot closet. four way test every rotary meeting begins prayer, pledge allegiance, reciting four way test singing song. our song day was "god bless america". there were sixty members from wide range ages, backgrounds ethnicities, though none mattered. me they were neighbors i'd never met, principled dedicated doing right thing. founded 1905, rotary club has been doing right thing long time. they have 1.2 million members 33,000 chapters six continents. their mission statement "combat hunger, improve health sanitation, provide education job training, promote peace eradicate polio". their "ambassadorial scholarship" program has enabled 40,000 students from 100 countries live one year foreign family. while promoting functional mass transit system early nineties i was guest speaker fifty rotary meetings at thirty different chapters. if there better path truth understanding than rotarians, then i'm not aware it. certainly not articulated or practiced by either political party or government bureaucracy. rotary international not political organization i am neither member nor spokesman. just speaker honored guest i can state, have no finer neighbors than these dedicated volunteer servants. there urgent need political reform save america reform cannot modeled either existing corrupt parties. rotary, lions, optimist, kiwanis other service clubs connected unpoisoned roots america. i look forward day when all america can embrace their spirit service. day when former democrats, former republicans former libertarians can stand shoulder shoulder sing "god bless america".
title: poisoned roots now bearing poisoned fruit
authors: joseph olson, because without america, there no free world.

content: greg hunter: big banks big trouble, syria/north korea update, trump tax cuts update - video headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! by greg hunter's <url> international monetary fund (imf) says there nine big global banks big financial trouble. these nine banks represent $47 trillion assets. gregory mannarino traderschoice.net says these nine banks could all equivalent lehman brothers imploded financial markets 2008. imf agrees warns will only take one nine named banks cause global "systemic stress." citigroup only u.s. bank named by imf struggling global bank. turkey, nato ally, siding russia iran syria. going big problem trump administration u.s. backing kurds, which an enemy turkey. meanwhile, north korea, signs new ballistic missile test coming. how will trump administration respond? trump tax cuts facing big headwinds congress. some want more cuts some want less. conservatives do not want deficit explode, some democrats agree. potential trump tax cuts one big reasons stock market hitting new highs. some predict if tax cuts fail pass, markets will crash. join greg hunter he talks about these stories more weekly news wrap-up. (to donate <url> click here) after wrap-up: pat muth, author new book "a title making," will guest early sunday release. she documents ever since ross perot movement, america has been slowly waking up fact country run by crooks. it's now reaching critical mass provoke real change good citizens not donors. muth contends two parties today consist "we people" vs. "swamp creatures." it's an eye opening inspiring interview. related posts: <url>
title: greg hunter: big banks big trouble, syria/north korea update, trump tax cuts update - video

content: look south florence eleven miles distant watch wide, empty beach recede into misty horizon. look north two miles there, perched high bluff, beautiful heceta head lighthouse, most photographed arguably most beautiful lighthouse oregon coast, though i'm not sure how that's measured. then step elevator plunge 208 feet down into bowels mother earth experience lifetime. really. reasonable price admission you'll treated world's largest sea cave. it's not gimmick or circus trick, just nature hard at work carving out basalt rock one salty wave at time. yes, those sea lions down there lounging about, rubbing blubber, yelping multiplying, stinking up place. clear day view from headlands at sea lions cave visitors center outstanding. but step too close edge you'll get woozies, maybe wobblies, gaze down at fields wavy green grass plunge 300 feet blue pacific churning sloshing back-and-forth perpetual rolling ballet. although my photos long gone, i remember my first encounter mother-of-all-sea-caves like was 1984. back then underground observation platform was small chain-linked fence separated us from 90 stellar sea lions repose fifty feet below us rocks. was crowded mass pinniped mayhem autumn; reddish-brown herd eumetopias jubatuses; young males can weigh literal ton each, paunchy cows their respective harems looking coy some action, little ones, yearlings, just hanging out lounging about causing ruckus. if you've got binoculars, bring them. come think it, maybe was sweaty teddy from toledo i smelled, standing just wee bit too close afternoon elbowing his way front pack closer look. it's been while since i made memorable trip down hole. imagine superdome reduced scale, long football field twelve stories tall green ocean pouring through cave's entrance. sea lions' echoes ricochet off cavern walls decorated algae lichen stained random mosaics green, red shades purple. outside cave perched rocky ledges guillemots black cormorants, over there, gulls galore swirl twirl nest screech paint surrounding cliffs guano white. not far from shore, often within sight always delight, spouting gray whales plowing north or south, alaska or mexico, depending season. gorgeous 56 feet high, heceta head lighthouse was built 1894, sits 150-foot-high bluff has been lauded most visited beloved lighthouse america. very well might be. despite lighthouse undergoing significant renovations through 2012, which might make lighthouse tour problematic, shines long, sweeping beam light visible 21 miles out sea regarded strongest light oregon coast. according old black-and-white photos from turn century, surrounding headlands were devoid dense evergreen forest one finds today because fire leveled hillside back then rendering barren charcoal wasteland. recovered now, it's rich lush green which understandable given drenching oregon coast suffers during winter spring. blessed spectacular setting romantic ambiance, refurbished assistant lighthouse keeper's house, big, white two-stories tall, now classy bed-and-breakfast extremely popular. so plan ahead if its your to-do list there can long waiting list contend with. can handle 14 guests at time, has six queen beds six bathrooms, plus fully-equipped guest kitchen. bit pricey some, cost mitigated by renowned seven-course gourmet breakfast. accompanying 192-page cookbook, packed colorful photographs delicious recipes, must purchased separately. cape perpetua, another immense forested headland juts out into pacific rises respectable 800 feet above sea level (paved road access parking available up top) another must-stop your drive up coast. from strategically placed viewpoints can see many miles out sea up down coast. southward cascading mountain shoulders silhouette plunging through fog into burly ocean below. looking north through breaks spruce miles flat beach tiny, delightful ocean-side village yachats ("yah-hots") situated near mouth river same name pronunciation. though dominating landscape, cape isn't only attraction u.s. forest service's cape perpetua scenic area which includes 2,700 acres old-growth douglas fir, spruce western hemlock. scenic area also claims bragging rights giant, 600-year-old sitka spruce towers 185 feet high boasts 40-foot circumference near its base. do not cut tree down firewood. it's protected by law 2007 was recognized an official "heritage tree," guilt offering no doubt account rabid clear-cutting that's pretty much decimated vast majority oregon's coastal mountains. looking sadly up at silent sentinel siuslaw, sniff, it's hard imagine what coast range must have looked like 200 years ago before was gifted away powers mowed nub. was all i could do keep from wrapping my arms around big, beautiful chunk wood. but would give me away, wouldn't it? back 60s forest service constructed visitors center, vibrant now chock full information activities, cultural natural history exhibits, theater showcasing nature-themed films, an interactive children's science area. it's not your average visitors center. those yearning hike will love 26 miles trails wend through old growth out onto biologically rich, other-worldly tidepools near ocean's edge. but careful; occasionally copious amounts salt water squirt through air, water trapped geologic anomalies like devil's churn - big crack fills up explodes like old faithful when competing waves collide. don't forget visit cook's chasm spouting horn. meaning fear-monger, i'm here remind ocean not trifled with. plenty dead people would testify, if they could, potential dangers here elsewhere along coast, like state parks at yachats up road short way. danger especially acute during winter storms at high tide. turn your back at wrong time while you're engaged pretty starfish risk being overrun by sneaky two-story wave will crush against rocks, pulverize your skull mush drag your limp body out sea. happens. i've said before i'll say again: most scenic stretch coast begin at yachats two miles north cape perpetua ends near brookings california border - southern oregon coast. all quaint little villages along way, unpretentious yachats definitely makes my a-list. population around 800, its diminutive size doesn't accurately reflect rich lifestyle, beauty restful nature gem serves up. retirees second-home owners aren't only ones drawn yachats; young have been lured here well, artists romantics inspired by basaltic headlands, towering green mountains, miles empty sand beaches tidepools waiting explored, crashing white surf ragged edge town, beautiful meandering river full life. casual visitors in-the-know take time stop explore laid-back little secret, outdoor-lover's delight. its popularity attested by 20-plus lodges, cottages, inns, motels, hotels cabins, not mention numerous vacation rentals, many spectacular ocean views. clean, orderly quaint understatements. small town provides fine dining, modest scale, art galleries, bistros specialty shops. there miles public beach explore, walking bike paths amble along, three state parks within village proper, an expensive supermarket those who don't have time run big city newport (another attraction area) twenty-five miles up coast. we always swing through coastal-themed yachats our many drives down 101, mandatory stop. it's some best oregon has offer due part its relative isolation, tucked at foot coastal mountains. yachats special those longing peace quiet, invigorating scenery, friendly atmosphere welcoming community, all within vibrant natural setting will have coming back year after year.
title: yachats central oregon coast
authors: john treadwell dunbar, because without america, there no free world.

shows just how intriguing some similarities around movements dollar, movements bonds, movements gold, movements stocks, some ratios, even down crude oil, fed policy cpi. now there was basically from 1985 '87, once they kicked plaza accord, which depreciated dollar. lot intriguing connections there special report i'm writing this, it's called "what, me worry?" which we'd love make available any content: opinions vary topic, between those religion those without. they vary between politically motivated - those who believe morality based self-governance versus those who seek mans dominion over men through man-made, man-interpreted man-enforced laws. they even vary among believers, some whom believe an unwritten separation church state versus others who believe only which was actually written into our constitution by founders. if looking debate, few topics will so readily attract opposition. question faith or historical fact? it's hard get folks even agree that. then will have somehow separate fact from fiction, reporting these facts often more hysterical than historical. those who wish america godless society have developed plethora arguments support their agenda. but arguments not facts... we watch lawyers make arguments every day, seldom concerned any facts or even any sense real justice. but they can make an argument, sometimes very successful argument. if their argument not true, has justice been served? argument right if was made premise was all wrong, even though argument effective? america has always been one nation under god. though founders used generic terms like creator describe god, god they meant was their god, christian faith. atheists agnostics have long argued many founders were deists, using washington, jefferson, franklin, paine, hamilton, madison proof. however, each these cases, study their personal writings will debunk myth. how did america become one nation under god? dictionaries, terms "deist," "agnostic," "atheist" appear synonyms. basis, term deists would include those who believe there no god, those who believe distant, impersonal creator universe those who believe there no way know if god exists. brief study founders own writings prove beyond any reasonable doubt none notable founders fit description. thomas paine talked about "the error schools" teach sciences without "reference being who author them: all principles science divine origin." he stated "the evil has resulted from error schools teaching [science without god] has been generating pupils species atheism." benjamin franklin's 1749 plan education public schools pennsylvania insisted schools teach "the necessity public religion . . . excellency christian religion above all others, ancient or modern." franklin proposed biblical inscription seal united states; he chose new testament verse motto philadelphia hospital; he was one chief proponents paid chaplain congress; when franklin helped found college which bore his name 1787, was dedicated "a nursery religion learning" built "on christ, corner-stone." may 2, 1778, george washington charged his soldiers at valley forge "to distinguished character patriot, should our highest glory add more distinguished character christian." speech may 12, 1779, he claimed what children needed learn "above all" was "religion jesus christ," learn would make them "greater happier than they already are." june 8, 1783, he reminded nation "without humble imitation" "the divine author our blessed religion" we "can never hope happy nation", he resigned his post commander-in-chief. washington's own adopted daughter declared washington might well question his patriotism question his christianity. hamilton began work rev. james bayard form christian constitutional society help spread over world two things which hamilton said made america great: (1) christianity (2) constitution formed under christianity. only hamilton's death two months later thwarted his plan starting missionary society promote christian government. thomas jefferson himself declared, "i am real christian, say, disciple doctrines jesus." president united states, jefferson signed treaty kaskaskia tribe wherein he provided--at government's expense--christian missionaries. james madison trained ministry rev. dr. john witherspoon, madison's writings replete declarations his faith god christ. his letter attorney general bradford, madison laments public officials not bold enough about their christian faith public public officials should "fervent advocates cause christ." madison did allude "wall separation," but contemporary writers frequently omit madison's own definition "wall", which according madison, was only prevent congress from passing national law establish national religion. there have it... do any these men sound like deists you? not hard demonstrate america was indeed born one nation under god or god or creator they were referring was fact, jesus christ. alone should lay rest any honest debate over how america became nation built upon judeo-christian principles values. we can go on, founder after founder if want, but these men named by most who argue founders were at best, deists. why was america formed one nation under god? answer simple, yet vital importance every american, regardless their religious beliefs. answer begins these two words, "self-governance". patrick henry put way, "it cannot emphasized too strongly or too often great nation was founded not by religionists but by christians, not religions but gospel jesus christ". john adams said way, "we recognize no sovereign but god, no king but jesus! [<date>] he later explained, "we have no government armed power capable contending human passions unbridled by morality religion. avarice, ambition, revenge, or gallantry, would break strongest cords our constitution whale goes through net. our constitution was made only moral religious people. wholly inadequate government any other."--<date> point - historically indisputable america was born one nation under god. does not require faith, but instead common logic understand why. men without moral compass incapable long-term self-governance. founders knew because they had seen it. few modern americans have experienced what life would like godless society, void morality, so they question it. many americans place their trust man over god, so they pursue it. but there no question what america was, is, should or must order retain its position strength freest nation self-governed individuals earth. we will either free one nation under god, or we will nation fools unaware our common heritage road ruin under men search power. one does not have christian understand this. one must only understand man his insatiable hunger power. those search power must remove god from society order gain access power. those who allow them, do so at their own peril. course free not like simple truth. but truth will never change. has always been...and shall always be. * special thanks david barton at wallbuilders some reference material used herein.
title: why america one nation under god - not nation lawyers
authors: jb williams, because without america, there no free world.

content: california's pension fund looks shift blame avoid responsibility. steven greenhut writes: california public employees' retirement system's union defenders feign shock whenever pension reformers accuse "kicking can down road" dealing state's mounting pension debt. it's like scene from casablanca, when captain louis renault absolutely shocked find gambling going gambling house. calpers never going state obvious: "we know these massive, underfunded pensions not sustainable, but we're going do everything possible push problem into future blame everyone else problem." but pension fund's board might well have said much after two actions took at last week's sacramento meeting.
title: calpers shocked--just shocked--to find cities reeling under growing pension debt: new at reason

content: "draining swamp" doesn't matter long groupthink persists headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! despite ideological social divides currently plaguing our culture, one common theme seems hold across all differences; americans do not like congress. even relatively apolitical seem roused against them, many speaking out against recent bills congressional initiatives, phrases like, "drain swamp!" abounding social media. shouldn't more people lead better decisions? at least when comes government, answer would seem be: no. assumption seems if we could only get "right" people office, things would improve. however, would not seem problem people system, but an inherent flaw system itself. social psychology not discipline which tends address issues political organization. however, many current political issues, including recent wave hatred congress, can analyzed light social psychological principles, such classic theory groupthink. what groupthink? first studied by yale psychologist irving janis 1960s, groupthink refers tendency groups make bad or even disastrous decisions. groupthink was first studied by social psychologists after bay pigs when question was: how could president kennedy, cabinet experts, have made decision so flawed he himself would later call "stupid?" shouldn't more people lead better decisions? at least when comes government, answer would seem be: no. his 1972 book victims groupthink: psychological study foreign policy decisions fiascos, dr. janis identifies three risks groupthink's occurrence, which still taught psychology classrooms today: desire cohesiveness, structural faults, power situation. looking at how congress operates today, not hard see how inherently at risk groupthink understand slew bad/unpopular decisions which seem have become commonplace. three risks groupthink occurrence: congressmen like justin amash or senators like bernie sanders often touted "rabble-rousers." cohesion first risk groupthink an overwhelming desire cohesiveness. groups run risk groupthink when they value unity over making best/ethical decision. very often, when groups value unity too highly, they fall prey phenomenon deindividuation, foregoing individual beliefs principles favor those group. no longer matters what individual believes or wants such circumstances, it's matter yielding group influence. symptoms desire cohesion can include derogation dissenters, trying limit questioning group decisions, existence mindguards, individuals who ensure dissent kept minimum. it's not hard find examples these phenomena current political atmosphere. congressmen like justin amash or senators like bernie sanders often touted "rabble-rousers" who don't tow party line. idea often expressed principles should take backseat party unity party accomplishment, which so often takes form voting "right way." there also tests party "purity," such democrats' recent "pro-choice" test, idea "real" democrat cannot pro-life. structural faults when congressmen like rand paul have filibustered opposition their party's agenda, leaders like john mccain attack them, implying they need fall line. second risk groupthink structural faults, specifically insulation closed leadership. by being insulated from outside voices or dissenting opinions, all while being subjected leadership which discourages dissent dictates "how is," group likely doom itself making poor decision. congress seems inherently insulated when comes its decision-making. theory, congresspeople represent their constituency's interests at federal level. however, most congress-people not particularly touch their constituency. such insulation not congress's fault, but rather fault design; washington geographically isolated from most united states. getting touch one's congressperson can nigh impossible, especially if one far from washington. best-case scenario tends leaving messages congressional aides, but chances actual direct contact low. only exception seems campaign trail, goal which not governance, but re-election. senators, such insulation can doubly strong. passage 17th amendment, senators became essentially unaccountable any form local governance majority their term office. theory, direct election senators gives locals chance vote them out, but can hard remember senators' specific legislative actions when election season rolls around afterward, which can take several years. second structural fault which increases risk groupthink closed leadership: leaders who say "this how is." such leaders often play role mindguards: quashing dissent trying ensure congresspeople behave according party line rather than their own beliefs. again, it's not hard find instances recent politics. when congressmen like ted cruz or rand paul have filibustered opposition their own party's agenda, republican leaders like john mccain came out attack them as, essentially, traitors, implication being they need fall line, their own principles damned. power situation time pressures pose similar risk groupthink. third final risk groupthink power situation. very often, our behavior much function our circumstances our own individuality. two situational features increase likelihood groupthink: perceived threats time pressure. idea responding strongly quickly threat powerful, even evolutionarily advantageous. however, quick strong responses not often, if ever, best decisions. both parties often frame their agendas opposition an enemy, often opposite party. it's matter "defeating" other party via unanimous support, no room individual principles or beliefs. how 1000+ page-long legislation gets voted immediately, no chance discussion; action required, else "they" going win! time pressures pose similar risk groupthink. idea having get something - anything! - done before "they" can enact their sinister agenda seems define modern political rhetoric. we have pass healthcare/tax plans/net neutrality immediately! meanwhile, little chance elaboration or discussion these bills' merits given, shockingly, results rarely beneficial. until occurs, "swamp" going remain, no matter who inhabits what office. reducing groupthink's influence many strategies exist combating groupthink. however, two commonalities have emerged across most strategies: importance dissent providing time examine alternatives. current political climate, highly doubtful either these strategies feasible at federal level. congress, currently functions, rife partisan strife both socially geographically insulated, does not seem able resist groupthink. so what might solution? even at america's birth, our founders stressed danger centralized government gaining too much power ceasing truly represent their constituents. whatever solution found, utmost importance they kept touch those they represent partisan politics do not encourage legislation sake unity, but rather sake principle. until occurs, "swamp" going remain, no matter who inhabits what office. source: <url>
title: "draining swamp" doesn't matter long groupthink persists

content: all three vying power money. rahmbo school board dealing an unpleasant reality, reality none them understand, but reality nonetheless. there simply not enough money keep funneling into black hole failed chicago school system. nevertheless, teacher's union their members clamoring more more money themselves. look at past week an example why chicago perfect case study how liberalism consumes itself. have rahm emanuel, mayor far leftist who used president obama's left hand man. have chicago school board, all liberals. then have, finally, teacher's union whose leadership membership act like perfect little soldiers karl marx. all three conflict. if want see liberalism devouring itself, chicago great petri dish observe. there liberals always pitted against other liberals they vie an ever shrinking piece pie. those insisting bigger slice do not realize fact pie keeps getting smaller because liberalism first place. point note number one: chicago's teachers already among highest paid nation at $76,000 average salary. point note number two: chicago schools some worst performing state illinois 7 bottom 10 schools residing city. conclusion: simply dumping money into system, paying teachers boatload cash, keeping teachers who do not perform does not solve problem. yet there teachers, who failing educate our children, striking demanding more not educating our children. they have turned down 16% raise (something only government workers get these days) over 4 years. they demanding raises, job security, benefit guarantees. at same time, they fighting tooth nail against an evaluation process designed weed out teachers not earning their already hefty salaries. only liberal haven like chicago! what worse teachers who striking mindless zombies jumping because they being told jump. some signs useful idiots carrying very illustrative point. example, one signs carried by communist red clad strikers said: "schools people not profit." question useful idiot. how much "profit" did she make last year? did she pocket anything? oh, know she did! can certain she did not donate her time. but then again, she's liberal so don't expect her understand her own hypocrisy. it's ok her "profit", just not anyone else. one sign i have seen lot reads: "i am teacher!" yes, but question good teacher did earn your paycheck? see, that's point testing program school's wants institute. but bad teachers union leaders so frightened they might found they will not allow such things. another sign by afl-cio local #1 reads: "on strike better schools" well, they certainly can't get much worse! i say stay strike! then school district can hire new teachers replace incompetent, lazy teachers sense entitlement who currently teaching our children. way schools might actually get better! not what unionistas mean, but truth none-the-less. then there crazy woman hanging out school bus window sign: "students before bankers." huh? that's just nonsensical. but ok, let's go it! teacher's union, i am sure, has moron's pension invested banker somewhere. let's take money away from banker, her, write every student check instead. let them do they please. if they opt go get an education, great! if they choose sit around smoke crack, so-be-it. but make them sign waiver saying they understanding there will no future benefits if they adopt later approach. then when yummy brain decides she wants retire, she'll no doubt rant scream about where her money is. we will just point back photographic evidence her philosophy remind her her money, once held by bankers, went students instead. oh, by way, considering strike she supports left 400,000 students out school, sign should actually read, if were honest, "myself before students." seriously, i have never seen big bunch whiners! or idiots matter. there something seriously wrong mentality engrained many our teachers these days. note i said "many". i did not say "all" or even "most". but there many who feel they entitled teachers if they simply want teachers. yet rest us actually have prove ourselves competent at our profession order keep our jobs. we don't get guaranteed raises every year because contract. no, we have prove ourselves worthy every year when evaluation time rolls around. i feel sorry those teachers who actually good teachers. there many them. but display chicagoland gives even those good teachers bad reputation. personally i would let them keep striking hire replacement teachers. we need people teaching our children who actually want teach. we don't need people who look at profession scheme make nearly twice much average chicago resident paying their salary does.
title: chicagoland: useful idiocy display
authors: j.j. jackson, because without america, there no free world.

content: president trump's plan continue deploying american military forces syria goes beyond his authority under federal law, according top senate democrat. "we precipice committing u.s. forces another forever war," maryland sen. ben cardin, ranking member foreign relations committee, said thursday. was rebuke secretary state rex tillerson, who outlined trump's policy syria following destruction islamic state landholding terrorist organization. tillerson explained u.s. forces diplomats must work prevent resurgence isis domination syria by iranian-backed terrorists. but cardin maintained new policy exceeds anything authorized by congress. "i am extremely disappointed trump administration announced significant change u.s. policy -- commitment u.s. forces an indefinite period time syria -- without first consulting congress," cardin said. "the trump administration lacks authority keep u.s. military forces syria after defeat isis." trump, like former president barack obama, has traced legal authority counter-isis operations back legislation authorized military action action against al qaeda response sept. 11, 2001 terrorist attacks. isis formed out remnants al qaeda's affiliate iraq. tillerson tied new syria policy legal basis by noting potential isis rehabilitate itself absence u.s. forces. "isis presently has one foot grave, by maintaining an american military presence syria until full complete defeat isis achieved, will soon have two," he said. tillerson's telling, such complete victory -- over isis or iranian forces country -- depends success broader effort bring peace stability syria. "ungoverned spaces, especially conflict zones, breeding grounds isis other terrorist organizations," he said. "u.s. disengagement from syria would provide iran opportunity further strengthen its position syria. we have seen from iran's proxy wars public announcements, iran seeks dominance middle east destruction our ally, israel. destabilized nation one bordering israel, syria presents an opportunity iran all too eager exploit." unveiling plan could renew congressional interest crafting new legislation defining president's legal authority conduct counter-terrorism operations. years, lawmakers both parties have struggled agree details new authorization use military force. "congress has been unable bridge gap between those who see new aumf primarily an opportunity limit president those who believe constraining commander chief wartime unwise," senate foreign relations chairman bob corker, r-tenn., said during recent hearing. tillerson's announcement sure spark new round debate policy, though. "the state defense departments must immediately consult members senate foreign relations committee, which retains jurisdiction over use military force," cardin said.

content: something wrong at newsweek, whoever charge over there needs get handle situation. its most recent misstep occurred week when its social media team tweeted misleading headline: "fact check: no, clintons were not paid millions by russia." accompanying article proves nothing sort. supposed fact check comes response tweet week from president trump read, "russia sent millions clinton foundation." .@foxandfriends "russia sent millions clinton foundation"-- donald j. trump (@realdonaldtrump) <date> he not wrong, newsweek article acknowledges much. acknowledges former president bill clinton received generous $500,000 speaking fee 2010 from kremlin-linked bank ties uranium one, canadian uranium company had mines u.s. newsweek article also acknowledges separate new york times report showed uranium one's chairman donated approximately $2.35 million clinton foundation four separate installments his company was being acquired by russian nuclear energy firm called rosatom. there's more from times report, none reflects well clintons: russians gradually assumed control uranium one three separate transactions from 2009 2013, canadian records show, flow cash made its way clinton foundation. uranium one's chairman used his family foundation make four donations totaling $2.35 million. those contributions were not publicly disclosed by clintons, despite an agreement mrs. clinton had struck obama white house publicly identify all donors. other people ties company made donations well. only thing newsweek fact check disputes whether millions paid had anything do rosatom's successful efforts secure approval from state department acquire uranium one. u.s. committee foreign investment gave go-ahead october 2010, handing russian state-owned nuclear agency control 20 percent uranium america. it's unclear whether russian cash given clinton foundation had anything do bill clinton's attempts 2010 facilitate meetings rosatom executives. it's also unclear whether payments had anything do his decision meet privately russian president vladimir putin same year. but still long way off from, "fact check: no, clintons were not paid millions by russia." aggravatingly enough, headline appears newsweek's website evenhanded reasonable. reads simply, "did russia send money bill clinton's foundation like trump says? fact-checking president's claim." it's social media version headline that's atrocious. said, like tweeted headline, body fact check also makes claims can't quite back, including, "president stretching truth about clinton foundation money received." well, perhaps. but clinton foundation did take millions from russians. that's what president tweeted. here's how newsweek fact check concludes, "yes, foundation received money bill clinton was paid give speech, but there's no evidence clintons were paid by russians push through uranium deal." correct, it'd probably devastating were thing president actually said. but he didn't quite say that. he implied it, sure. but what's use fact checking things haven't been said?
title: newsweek 'fact check' denies russian payments clintons, even though payments happened
