content: small cap value report (tue 23 jan 2018) - quindell, elco, lpa, boku, eye, flo, ssy % readers think story fact. add your two cents. headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! hi, it's paul here. please feel free post your comments, small cap requests comments below. quindell postscript announcement caught my eye. audit firm which signed off quindell's dodgy accounts 2010/11 has been fined ps700k + ps90k costs by financial reporting council (frc). obscure body supposedly polices published accounts. however rarely seems take action, when does, very slow. audit partner responsible, has also been reprimanded (big deal!) fined ps56k - which not material sum money partner decent-sized accountancy firm. also, look at timeline - it's now 7 years from those incorrect accounts being created. hardly rapid response team! longer term readers here will remember, i was consistently very bearish quindell, since its accounts were fairly obviously highly suspect. excessive debtors, excessive capitalisation into intangible assets, flurry acquisitions muddy waters, usual give-aways fake profits, so these dodgy companies really terribly easy spot. can spot highly abnormal balance sheet just few seconds, so really doesn't take any particular forensic accounting skills uncover dodgy companies false profits. just have have your wits about you. same was true globo. was amazing how much venom from deluded fools investing community my bearish comments attracted over these 2 dodgy companies. there was even an attempt get me sacked from role at stockopedia, by quindell/globo shareholders cancelling their stockopedia subscriptions! course, ed put editorial integrity before short term revenues, backing me hilt. i was proven correct by subsequent events, was very satisfying. anyway, perpetrators quindell globo frauds still at large, their ill-gotten gains, having relieved gullible uk investors hundreds millions pounds. i sadly commented an investor friend at weekend, white collar crime uk very much does pay. action taken by frc, reported today, too little, too late, my view, properly punish, or deter, same sort thing happening again. kudos by way, tom winnifrith, his tireless, obsessive exposure multiple wrongdoings at both quindell globo. people may not like his style, but he's done outstanding work exposing many dodgy companies. having worked audit myself, at start my career early 1990s, i can confirm it's really very easy pull wool over eyes auditors. their checks numbers not very detailed, clever fd can cover up all sorts problems. so onus very much investors do our own reasonableness-checking published accounts. if numbers don't look right, then it's best steer clear. popular misconception auditors highly paid. they're actually not. audits often tendered at low prices, order get foot door, enable more lucrative tax, acquisition-related work secured. there seems an invisible force pulling american markets relentlessly higher, no significant pullback long time. very worrying. some describing "melt up". not normal, or healthy market behaviour, my view. could we heading crash? i don't know. markets meant "climb wall worry", regular corrections. seemingly unstoppable move upwards could precursor violent correction, possibly? successful trader mark minervini recently tweeted only times he can remember american market being exuberant, were just before 1987 crash, just before <url> bubble bursting 2000. however, big rise could justified? maybe us shares re-rating because big corporate tax cuts us will increase earnings considerably? turn could trigger an economic boom, increased investment amp; virtuous circle higher growth, greater consumer spending, etc. who knows? that's what happened under president reagan, after all - he initially stimulated us economy big tax cuts, which ushered period great economic success. these things impossible predict, nearly all forecasters get so wrong would have expected them pack forecasting bad job. yet strangely, people (especially media) still treat their forecasts quite unjustified reverence. economics still very much its infancy, has barely scratched surface, terms being able accurately predict what economy will do practice. so i think it's best accept we haven't got clue what future holds. despite this, i'm increasingly nervous about market melt-up, so have opened some short positions us markets. that's proving expensive so far, but i don't mind losses hedges. they're an insurance policy, insurance costs money. regards uk markets, i'm seeing lot nervousness small mid caps at moment. feels like days everything going up, day after day, now over. we've been spoiled by very buoyant market conditions, long time now. there many former momentum stars, which have sold off considerably last few months (e.g. boohoo.com (lon:boo) (i'm long) iqe (lon:iqe) . investors seem ignoring many satisfactory, or even good updates, banking profits instead. there certainly seems lack investor appetite take small caps new highs at moment. that's probably quite sensible actually, lots small caps now very pricey, uk economy seems soft patch, so there seem lots profit warnings being issued. mind you, bargains can found illiquid markets, when some investors start throwing out baby bath water, and/or see their stop losses triggered no particular underlying reason. i favour such market conditions, from time time market throws bargain my direction, people sometimes act irrationally - scared out good shares by erratic spikes down price. anyway, let's have look at some small cap announcements today. by way, i apologise any typos today - am using small laptop, screen i'm struggling see properly. (lon:elco) share price: 45.5p (up 8.3% today) no. shares: 77.4m market cap: ps35.2m (at time writing, i hold long position share) trading statement elecosoft plc (aim: elco), aim-listed construction software specialist... clever wording makes sounds better than is! an line update; ... pleased announce revenue profit before tax trading year ended 31 december 2017 both expected significantly higher compared revenue profit before tax year ended 31 december 2016 line market expectations. cash generation sounds good; elecosoft's strong conversion operating profits into cash year enabled group eliminate its net borrowing position at 30 june 2017 also improve its net cash position further at 31 december 2017. i love when companies eliminate their debt through cash generation. other points; high customer renewal rates (a good sign - product must good) emphasis good training amp; support customers (again, good thing) successful acquisition has been integrated. favourable forex movements. outlook - nothing specific, just says "look forward confidence" my opinion - i picked up few these shares while back, positive update. generally i'm not keen software companies, they're quite prone profit warnings - often being heavily reliant lumpy licence sales. share looks priced about right, my view. it's good have reassuring update today under its belt. stockopedia remains convinced, "neutral" style, middling stockrank 51. let's hope those improve, if financial performance continues good. (lon:lpa) share price: 172,5p (up 0.9% today, at 12:51) no. shares: 12.38m market cap: ps21.4m (at time writing, i have long position share) final results - year ended 30 sep 2017 lpa group plc (lpa) designer, manufacturer supplier light emitting diode (led)-based lighting electro-mechanical systems. announces today; ...record results year ended 30 september 2017 strong start new financial year. company put out positive-sounding trading update, which i covered here 1 nov 2017. often happens, surge share price day (responding positive update amp; outlook) continued, share price rising about another 12% today. i won't spend long company, it's too small amp; illiquid - i was only able pick up few shares. might interest readers small portfolios, who don't have problem illiquid positions. key points; revenues up 5% ps22.5m pre-exceptional operating profit up 24% ps1.9m (exceptionals negligible, so nothing worry about there) basic eps up 17.1% 14.4p - giving per 12.0 dividends modest, but growing - up from 2.5p last year, 2.7p year - yield 1.6% order intake amp; closing order book both up nicely, so outlook amp; visibility positive. recent trading - q1 "significantly ahead" prior year. balance sheet - looks fine me, sound working capital position. there's little debt, but i don't see problem. note there pension fund, which surplus an accounting level, but may deficit an actuarial basis. it's not significant, cashflow statement shows ps100k p.a. payments by company into fund. capex looks high, but narrative mentions relocating its factory, which likely have caused spike capex. my opinion - based quick review only, i quite like figures amp; outlook here. so micro cap investors, happy accept poor market liquidity, might worth closer look. seems soundly financed, performing well, has strong order book. plus pays modest divis. i think would worthwhile do some more digging, understand what products makes. crucial consideration whether demand likely continue, or whether company riding crest wave from one-off orders? overall though, it's worth closer look i think. note stockopedia data (from thomson reuters) shows only 9.5p eps expectation 2017. so actual eps 14.4p long way ahead that. therefore, we can probably anticipate an improving stockrank, once actual numbers flow through. so i'll wager middling stockrank could start improve soon; (lon:boku) share price: 85p (unchanged today) no. shares: 213.5m market cap: ps181.5m trading update boku (aim: boku), world's leading independent direct carrier billing company, pleased provide following unaudited trading update year ended 31 december 2017. company's first trading update since admission aim november 2017. my understanding company's software enables people buy things their mobile phones (apps, games, etc) without need credit card. cost instead routed their mobile phone bill, or prepaid account. useful countries where credit cards not widely used. 2017 revenues exceed $24m - up 40% 2016 - an adjusted ebitda positive second half we know, adjusted ebitda can hide multitude sins - especially at software companies, where large amounts overheads can capitalised, thus flattering ebitda. impressive; total processed value (tpv)** $1.7bn 2017 was more than triple 2016 amount $554 million thanks continued growth across all customer segments - most notably app stores digital music subscriptions amp; bundling although if tripling total processed value only results 40% rise revenues, doesn't suggest individual transactions being done lot more cheaply? looking stockreport, my first port call any new company historical graphs. these have already scared me off; my opinion - it's clearly jam tomorrow situation. ps181.5m market cap clearly includes some heroic assumptions about future growth. i don't tend buy into things like that, unless i really understand sector amp; business, which not case here. so i think one really just punters, people who properly understand business, think it's likely deliver massive growth necessary current market cap (let alone higher one). reminds me bango (lon:bgo) which looks similar, also relying exponential growth justify its extremely high (relative historic losses) valuation. so these 2 shares could multibaggers, if growth gains momentum, or they could crash disastrously, if growth disappoints, heavy losses continue - requiring further fundraises future. high risk, potentially high reward. they're not me - why take risk? (lon:eye) share price: 224p (down 0.9% today, at 14:19) no. shares: 25.4m market cap: ps56.9m trading update eagle eye, saas technology company allows businesses create real-time connection their customers here's our archive my 3 previous reports company. can find list articles any company, just by putting ticker, then clicking "discuss" tab, at top stockreport. i don't like company's new description what does, doesn't actually explain what company does! its previous description from july 2017 announcement was much more clear; saas technology company validates redeems digital promotions real-time grocery, retail hospitality industries why change something clear, something opaque? very odd thing do. clarity, simplicity always best. reports today progress h1 2017/18, being 6 months 31 dec 2017. so has 30 june 2018 year end. here highlights, presented by company, yellow highlighting from me; there strong growth various kpis there, but revenue only up 28% - not madly exciting. i tend prefer revenue growth 40%+ at growth companies - because don't need grow at rate compounded, long before figures get exciting. cash - other thing jumps out at me from list, company seems have burned through most its cash. looking back through previous rnss, company raised ps6m (before expenses) or ps5.8m after expenses, jun 2017. so i'm rather surprised it's only got ps0.8m left. maybe there was some debt was repaid part previous fundraise? ah yes, i've spotted ps3m facility barclays last full year accounts, which looks if it's currently undrawn. i'm not keen loss-making companies using bank borrowings. clearly company will need do another placing fairly soon, it's still cash hungry. lot development costs being capitalised. not necessarily problem, company seems well-supported by investors, generous market cap loss-making company. so raising, say, another ps5m would only result c.10% dilution - unhelpful, but not disaster. outlook - there's lots commentary today's update about customer wins, etc. conclusion is; ... confidence delivering its expectations financial year ending 30 june 2018. my opinion - there's definitely something interesting here, my view. company clearly has an interesting, innovative product, big name customers. however, me financial progress has date been somewhat limited. it's still quite heavily loss-making. looking at broker forecasts, there big expectations revenue growth, rising ps22.8m 06/2019, ps32.8m 06/2020. yet these big increases revenues would only just tip into normalised profit before tax just ps0.9m 06/2020. i'm struggling see how justifies ps56.9m market cap now. share would therefore only interest me, if i could convinced company set smash those forecasts, deliver much higher growth future profitability. things stand though, i think looks an interesting company, promising-sounding product, but financials don't look very good yet, price looks bit toppy. plus will need raise more equity fairly soon, so i'd rather hold fire re-assess once it's properly funded. i'd say placing ps10m+ really necessary, rather than doing repeat, smaller fundraisings. danger that, fundraising window can easily slam shut, future bear market, leaving company potentially high amp; dry. stockopedia computers only award eye low stockrank 21 - which understandable, early stage, loss-making companies nearly always fail excite either stockopedia algorithms, or me! anyway, i wish company well, look forward reviewing again when next set numbers come out. usual, i reserve right change my mind at any time, if growth accelerates makes more exciting investment proposition. (lon:flo) share price: 177.25p (down 3.1% today) no. shares: 52.8m market cap: ps93.6m trading update london: tuesday 23 january 2018: aim listed specialist technical fluid power products supplierflowtech fluidpower plc (lse: symbol flo), pleased announce following unaudited update its performance year ended 31 december 2017 period up announcement... update starts an line expectations comment, positive noises about further expansion; "pbt line expectations, whilst group's heightened profile enhanced technical skills capabilities created both uk europe has ensured opportunities further significant expansion have continued presented" revenues up 45% ps77.9m. scanning through rns, group seems have made several acquisitions 2017, which has obviously pushed up revenues. organic growth good, at +8%. net debt has risen 12% ps14.7m. note there has also been some dilution year, from an equity fundraising. an excellent update, lots useful information; divisional gross margins remain broadly line prior year. result weightier mix towards generally lower margin pmc operations, slight reduction overall margin % projected, therefore, board expects underlying* profit before tax year ended 31 december 2017 will range 8.6m 8.8m, which line market expectations. i'm impressed group can give fairly tight range likely profit, 23 days after year end. suggests me has competent finance department, good internal controls. six acquisitions were made during year, which strikes me perhaps being bit too ambitious. there's risk might have stretched management bandwidth little thin? refurbished/redesigned shared logistics centre has also been completed, no disruption customer service. management team really have been busy! impressive stuff. dividends will rise 5%, giving yield 3.2% - not bad. valuation - looks reasonably priced, cheap side, even when adjust net debt; stockrank very high, also classified "super stock"; my opinion - i like it. stock we've looked at here before, felt positive about. strikes me good quality buy amp; build, which appears managed very well. i like decent operating profit margin - which comes from holding wide range niche spare parts various machinery, high levels customer service, e.g. rapid delivery options, which vital when clients' important machines idle, waiting spare part from flo. share looks me if could continue steady riser, more acquisitions bolted on. so thumbs up from me. here's flo chart (geddit?!!!) - if we'd bought dip july 2016, we'd 80% up, plus divis, by now. that's something think about. (work progress.) stockopedia source: <url>
title: small cap value report (tue 23 jan 2018) - quindell, elco, lpa, boku, eye, flo, ssy

content: juno captures stunning jovian 'pearl' headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! astro-imager damian peach reprocessed one latest images taken by juno's junocam during its 3rd close flyby planet dec. 11. photo highlights one large 'pearls' (right) forms string storms jupiter's atmosphere. smaller isolated storm seen at left. credit: nasa/jpl-caltech/swri/msss jupiter looks beautiful pearls! image, taken by junocam imager nasa's juno spacecraft, highlights one eight massive storms from distance form 'string pearls' jupiter's turbulent atmosphere. they're counterclockwise rotating storms appear white ovals gas giant's southern hemisphere. larger pearl photo above roughly half size earth. since 1986, these white ovals have varied number from six nine eight currently visible. four more 'pearls' photographed dec. 10, 2016 planet's south temperate belt below great red spot. moon ganymede at left. show up well photos but require good seeing at least 8-inch telescope see visually. credit: christopher go photos were taken during sunday's close flyby. at time closest approach -- called perijove -- juno streaked about 2,580 miles (4,150 km) above gas giant's roiling, psychedelic cloud tops traveling about 129,000 mph or nearly 60 km per second relative planet. seven juno's eight science instruments collected data during flyby. at time photos were taken, spacecraft was about 15,300 miles (24,600 km) from planet. original image sent by junocam dec. 11 features eighth string large storms planet's southern hemisphere. credit: nasa/jpl-caltech/swri/msss junocam color, visible-light camera designed capture remarkable pictures jupiter's poles cloud tops. juno's eyes, will provide wide view, helping provide context spacecraft's other instruments. junocam was included spacecraft specifically purposes public engagement; although its images will helpful science team, not considered one mission's science instruments. 4-frame animation spans 24 jovian days, or about 10 earth days. passage time accelerated by factor 600,000. some ovals visible well variety jets - west east east west. credit: nasa crazy swirls clouds we see photos composed ammonia ice crystals organized into dozen or so bands parallel equator called belts (the darker ones) zones. border each bounded by powerful wind flow called jet, resembling earth's jet streams, which alternate direction from one band next. zones colder mark latitudes where material upwelling from below. ammonia ice thought give zones their lighter color. belts contrast indicate sinking material; their color bit mysterious may due presence hydrocarbons -- molecules made from hydrogen, carbon, oxygen well exotic sulfur phosphorus compounds. use guide help better understand jupiter's arrangement belts zones, many which visible amateur telescopes. credit: nasa/jpl/wikipedia pearls or storms form windy jovian atmosphere can last many decades. some eventually dissipate while others merge form even larger storms. unlike hurricanes, which fall apart when they blow inland from ocean, there's no "land" jupiter, so storms get started there just keep going. biggest, great red spot, has been hanging around causing trouble delight (for telescopic observers) at least 350 years. juno's next perijove pass will happen feb. 2, 2017. post juno captures stunning jovian 'pearl' appeared first universe today. source: <url>
title: juno captures stunning jovian 'pearl'

content: 7 most annoying twitter auto dms headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! have seen "cheap supplements 4 you" or "register my business program you'll receive endless benefits." most likely thought was email spam. they're real examples spam, but from twitter. last week i wrote about 7 worst social media mistakes. one those mistakes annoying auto direct messages. may receive one these when engage someone's account by following them or liking tweet theirs. immediately after click "follow", program automatically sends pre-written message. i'm not entirely against idea auto dm services, but it's gotten completely out hand mostly used irresponsibly. end result an inbox saturated pointless messages, forcing your authentic one-on-one interactions bottom. here worst seven messages i've received: hola. gracias por seguirme. me dejas saber si hay algo en que lo puedo ayudar innovar! if you're going send anyone message, make sure it's person's native speaking language. even when translated, message standard "thanks, let me know if i can help." i'm not sure how many people asking help from strangers twitter sending pm. [suspicious looking domain] was it. just typo domain message screaming "click through at your own risk." thnx 4 following me. ceo you! #supply another generic message. i'm not sure what action want me take statement like this. hashtag unrelated their previous statement they didn't take time even spell out "thank you." one thing sure, i am ceo me, i'm supply. i appreciate one my recent follower. please rt if like my thoughts. linkedin: [removed] like my facebook page - there more than few things wrong dm. person's first mistake starting version "thank you." you're only adding insult injury by thanking someone through an automatic message. it's waste space we end up 100 them our inbox just saying "thanks." - at least we're heading some semblance correct direction one. they're giving us legitimate action take asking retweet them. your fans will retweet if they want to, not because asked using poor grammar. - doesn't make sense randomly insert their linkedin profile demand like their facebook page. apparently following them twitter just wasn't enough. if you're using automatic messages sales funnel, don't just direct someone another social platform unless you've heavily monetized it. send them sign up your newsletter or give them discount push them your web store instead. listen [removed] song my sound cloud channel?? one speaks itself. while might advantageous them get more traffic their song channel whatever reason, they failed insert entire name author song, what their channel is, or even link. if you're going request an action from stranger dm, don't make them do any research. hi edward zeiden! thank following!! what your hobbies or interests? message makes me think i accidentally signed up dating website. when open your eyes magic who are, even blackness night,...[it goes like 15 more lines] definitely one more unique ones, but still unwarranted, long, without point. if you're going use an auto dm service, make sure your message proofed grammar spelling, gives something back receiver true token gratitude, present clear concise action take. here's decent example i found: get 10% off your next order at [removed] code tweet10 at [website]. i'm not thrilled receiving an ad i didn't sign up for, but it's step right direction. if they also sent me medium link an educational article they wrote aligned my interests, would soften blow. remember when use an auto dm service, it's usually increase engagement twitter, push users your website read your blog, take survey, or buy something. if you're not doing one these, quick professional manner, it's best skip message try tweeting real content. source: <url>

content: playing hitler card headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! redneck's guide reversing their control your brain no matter how historically incorrect, so many people (jews non-jews) cannot help but use their brainwashed minds play hitler card. case point stephen lendman's recent post about israeli viciousness: israel treats palestinians way hitler persecuted jews. every day kristallnacht long-suffering people under apartheid conditions worse than south africa's. not say he incorrect about israeli viciousness (because they apparently vicious, murdering monsters). not argue his defense palestinians (because i agree). but smart people (much like sweetie zuesse) continually use standard erroneous brainwashing bolster point, direct opposition historical fact, makes them opportunists at best liars at worst. i don't think there another subject so erroneously engrained within psyche world devious jewish one using hitler, nsdap germany general, bolster sympathy jews/israel cover their carnage against world. i have shown sweetie liar several times, but lendman (i believe) just mistaken found using meme will fortify his point. lendman could have used another example based upon truth. let's accurate, shall we? too bad lendman still uses hitler card, even when attacking israel (and towards jews small degree). but truth hitler was disgusted those two nights had nothing do their instigation or implementation. was stain his party totally against his direction desires. what really happened during crystal night now let us look at what really happened during fateful night. after 1945 any harm ever done any jew national socialist germany has been described great detail many publications combined other.stories give exaggerated figures which have then become so-called "historical truth." how strange then despite passage more than forty years, no one has established true extent damage done jews during crystal night. all one can learn from history writers "all" synagogues were demolished "all" shop windows were destroyed. aside from vague description, one given almost no details. basis so-called "historical truth" about crystal night, president world jewish congress, nahum goldmann, had chutzpah 1952 claim 500 million dollars from german chancellor konrad adenauer reparation payment damage done during november night. when adenauer asked goldmann his justification enormous request, goldmann replied: "you find justification yourself! what i want not justification but money." [note 7] he got his money! goldmann may have interpreted willingness german chancellor pay half billion dollars proof claim all synagogues had been destroyed. why else would germany so foolish pay something which never happened? all same, "historical truth" "all" german synagogues were destroyed lie. 1938 there were approximately 1,400 synagogues germany, which only about 180 were destroyed or damaged. furthermore, jews owned approximately 100,000 shops department stores germany 1938. number, only about 7,500 had their windows broken. these figures show just how much so-called "historical truth" differs from what actually happened. damage destruction did actually occur was, course, terrible shame, but exaggerations, especially by german historians who use them condemn their own people, also shame. history writers tell us during crystal night all jews were frightened, meekly accepted whatever happened them watched destruction their property no resistance. contrary true. while going through files subject, i found many documents which report precisely just opposite what claimed. fact many cases jews their german neighbors fought together against attackers, pushing them down staircases. street mobs were beaten up chased away more than one case. police party officials were generally side jews. some jewish community leaders went police stations next morning asked police investigate damage done their synagogues. resulting police reports still available files today. also contrary what we have been told, most jews were not directly affected by these events. berlin, example, all teachers pupils city's largest jewish school, which served entire berlin area, appeared their classes next morning without having noticed anything unusual during previous night. heinemann stern, jewish principal school, wrote his postwar memoirs he noticed burning synagogue his way school morning after crystal night, but he thought was just an accidental fire. was only after he arrived at school he received telephone call informing him destruction previous night. he then went his classes day only during first recess did he take trouble inform entire student body about what had happened. [note 8] how can such evidence reconciled claim by herman graml, prominent german historian associate munich institute contemporary history, who wrote: "every single jew was beaten, chased, robbed, insulted humiliated. sa tore jews from their beds, mercilessly beat them their apartments then ... chased them almost death ... blood flowed everywhere." [note 9] conceivable thousands jewish children would have been sent school by their parents morning after fateful night if attacks against jews had been so horrific or extensive? would any parents have let their children go school if they had thought there was even slightest danger them being attacked by roving gangs sa men? i think answer clearly no! deplorable things did indeed happen which were bad enough, but fantasies modern historians history writers such graml simply inexcusable. really, isn't silly compare 2 day event, immediately shunned by very one lendman (and everyone else) blames, half-century long apartheid? content: chris hedges, truthdig corporate forces looting treasury have plunged us into depression will not contained by two main political parties. democratic republican parties have become little more than squalid clubs privilege wealth, whores money corporate interests, hostage massive arms industry, so adept at deception self-delusion they no longer know truth from lies. we will either find our way out mess by embracing an uncompromising democratic socialism--one will insist massive government relief work programs, nationalization electricity gas companies, universal, not-for-profit government health care program, outlawing hedge funds, radical reduction our bloated military budget an end imperial wars--or we will continue fleeced impoverished by our bankrupt elite shackled chained by our surveillance state. free market globalization, promised route worldwide prosperity, have been exposed con game. but does not mean our corporate masters will disappear. totalitarianism, george orwell pointed out, not so much an age faith an age schizophrenia. "a society becomes totalitarian when its structure becomes flagrantly artificial," orwell wrote, "that when its ruling class has lost its function but succeeds clinging power by force or fraud." force fraud all they have left. they will use both. there political shift europe toward an open confrontation corporate state. germany has seen surge support die linke (the left), political grouping formed 18 months ago. co-led by veteran socialist "red" oskar lafontaine, who has built his career attacking big business. two-thirds germans public opinion polls say they agree all or some die linke's platform. socialist party netherlands verge overtaking labor party main opposition party left. greece, beset street protests violence by disaffected youths, has seen rapid rise coalition radical left. spain norway socialists power. resurgence not universal, especially france britain, but shifts toward socialism significant. corporations have intruded into every facet life. we eat corporate food. we buy corporate clothes. we drive corporate cars. we buy our vehicular fuel our heating oil from corporations. we borrow from corporate banks. we invest our retirement savings corporations. we entertained, informed branded by corporations. we work corporations. creation mercenary army, privatization public utilities our disgusting for-profit health care system all legacies corporate state. these corporations have no loyalty america or american worker. they not tied nation states. they vampires. "by now [commercial] revolution has deprived mass consumers any independent access staples life: clothing, shelter, food, even water," wendell berry wrote "the unsettling america." "air remains only necessity average user can still get himself, revolution had imposed heavy tax by way pollution. commercial conquest far more thorough final than military defeat." corporation designed make money without regard human life, social good or impact environment. corporate laws impose legal duty corporate executives make much money possible shareholders, although many have moved fleece shareholders well. 2003 documentary film "the corporation" management guru peter drucker says: "if find an executive who wants take social responsibilities, fire him. fast." corporation attempts engage social responsibility, tries pay workers decent wage benefits, invests its profits protect environment limit pollution, gives consumers fair deals, can sued by shareholders. robert monks, investment manager, says film: "the corporation an externalizing machine, same way shark killing machine. there isn't any question malevolence or will. enterprise has within it, shark has within it, those characteristics enable do which was designed." ray anderson, ceo interface corp., world's largest commercial carpet manufacturer, calls corporation "present day instrument destruction" because its compulsion "externalize any cost an unwary or uncaring public will allow externalize." "the notion we can take take take take, waste waste, without consequences, driving biosphere destruction," anderson says. short, film, based joel bakan's book "the corporation: pathological pursuit profit power," asserts corporation exhibits many traits found people clinically defined psychopaths. psychologist dr. robert hare lists film psychopathic traits ties them behavior corporations: callous unconcern feelings others; incapacity maintain enduring relationships; reckless disregard safety others; deceitfulness: repeated lying conning others profit; incapacity experience guilt; failure conform social norms respect lawful behavior. yet, under american legal system, corporations have same legal rights individuals. they give hundreds millions dollars political candidates, fund army some 35,000 lobbyists washington thousands more state capitals write corporate-friendly legislation, drain taxpayer funds abolish government oversight. they saturate airwaves, internet, newsprint magazines advertisements promoting their brands friendly face corporation. they have high-priced legal teams, millions employees, skilled public relations firms thousands elected officials ward off public intrusions into their affairs or halt messy lawsuits. they hold near monopoly all electronic printed sources information. few media giants--aol-time warner, general electric, viacom, disney rupert murdoch's newsgroup--control nearly everything we read, see hear. "private capital tends become concentrated [a] few hands, partly because competition among capitalists, partly because technological development increasing division labor encourage formation larger units production at expense smaller ones," albert einstein wrote 1949 monthly review explaining why he was socialist. "the result these developments an oligarchy private capital enormous power which cannot effectively checked even by democratically organized political society. true since members legislative bodies selected by political parties, largely financed or otherwise influenced by private capitalists who, all practical purposes, separate electorate from legislature. consequence representatives people do not fact sufficiently protect interests underprivileged sections population. moreover, under existing conditions, private capitalists inevitably control, directly or indirectly, main sources information (press, radio, education). thus extremely difficult, indeed most cases quite impossible, individual citizen come objective conclusions make intelligent use his political rights." labor left-wing activists, especially university students well-heeled liberals, have failed unite. division, which often based social rather than economic differences, has long stymied concerted action against ruling elites. has fractured american left rendered impotent. "large sections middle class being gradually proletarianized; but important point they do not, at any rate not first generation, adopt proletarian outlook," orwell wrote 1937 during last economic depression. "here i am, instance, bourgeois upbringing working-class income. which class do i belong to? economically i belong working class, but almost impossible me think myself anything but member bourgeoisie. supposing i had take sides, whom should i side with, upper class which trying squeeze me out existence, or working class whose manners not my manners? probable i, personally, any important issue, would side working class. but what about tens or hundreds thousands others who approximately same position? what about far larger class, running into millions time--the office-workers black-coated employees all kinds--whose traditions less definite middle class but who would certainly not thank if called them proletarians? all these people have same interests same enemies working class. all being robbed bullied by same system. yet how many them realize it? when pinch came nearly all them would side their oppressors against those who ought their allies. quite easy imagine working class crushed down worst depths poverty still remaining bitterly anti-working-class sentiment; being, course, ready-made fascist party." coalitions environmental, anti-nuclear, anti-capitalist, sustainable-agriculture anti-globalization forces have coalesced europe form support socialist parties. has yet happen united states. left never rallied significant numbers behind cynthia mckinney or ralph nader. picking lesser two evils, threw its lot democratic party backs our imperial wars, empowers national security state does bidding corporations. if barack obama does not end flagrant theft taxpayer funds by corporate slugs disgraceful abandonment our working class, especially foreclosures unemployment mount, many country will turn desperation far right embodied by groups such christian radicals. failure by left offer democratic socialist alternative will mean there will be, eyes many embittered struggling working- middle-class americans, no alternative but perverted christian fascism. inability articulate viable socialism has been our gravest mistake. will ensure, if does not soon change, ruthless totalitarian capitalism.

regime ever. more fundamental critique levied at negative interest policy leads behavior opposite what central banks want. portfolio rebalancing theory suggests lowering benchmark yield via desire seek higher returns equity credit markets, opposite what central banks sought achieve unconventional policies. finally, negative interest rates send signal economy dire need emergency support. rethink its strategy. specifically, central bank could choose keep its deposit rate unchanged next month, compensate larger-than-expected extension increase qe. but we doubt will choose route. content: study: cbd administration enhances skeletal healing % readers think story fact. add your two cents. headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! originally published at blog.norml.org administration non-psychotropic cannabinoid cannabidiol (cbd) leads improvement bone fracture healing, according preclinical data published online ahead print journal bone mineral research. investigators at hebrew university bone laboratory israel assessed ability cbd administration promote healing rats mid-femoral fractures. researchers reported, "cbd markedly enhanced biomechanical properties healing femora after 8 weeks." authors also evaluated administration thc cbd together, but reported combined preparation was "not advantageous" over cbd alone -- indicating plant's potential bone-stimulating properties primarily specific cannabidiol. they concluded: "cbd alone sufficiently effective enhancing fracture healing. ... multiple experimental clinical trials have portrayed cbd safe agent suggesting further studies humans assess its usefulness improving fracture healing." researchers have previously acknowledged endogenous cannabinoids stimulate bone formation inhibit bone loss, potentially paving way future use cannabinoid drugs combating osteoporosis. source: <url>
title: study: cbd administration enhances skeletal healing

content: stressed? here three ways help tackle anxiety headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! i don't know about you, but life seems pretty stressful at moment. so, these suggestions ways help tackle anxiety from health fitness expert, former schoolteacher, brian keane couldn't have come at better time. anxiety one most common mental health issues. according three-year study by office national statistics (<url> women more likely feel anxious compared men those who registered most anxious were aged between 50 54. (the ons unable collect information clinically diagnosed cases anxiety depression.) brian keane said he suffered from anxiety while working teacher. he found himself having sleepless nights consistently worried about his performance at work. four years brian worried about his sleep pattern his working life, which resulted him consuming sugary foods drinks maintain his energy. brian said: "i always thought anxiety meant didn't have your life together - regardless what may see, nobody has every area their life together - my only experience anxiety was when colleagues would get signed off work due stress. "i didn't have enough self-awareness realise it's something all us face at some time or another some people, it's chronic affects them every single day. others, can chemically induced - too much caffeine, alcohol drugs. regardless, more people i meet, more i realise everyone experiences anxiety some way, shape or form "there some serious cases anxiety, if have suffered any major physical or mental trauma or have hormonal imbalance, would probably best consult your physician. however, i hope by sharing my own experiences strategies, i will ultimately support managing any kind day-to-day anxiety or worry may limiting any aspect your own life." brian keane's new book fitness mindset, which achieved eight weeks at top amazon bestseller's chart, has tips improving fitness how achieve mindset overcome obstacles such anxiety stress. addresses tactics brian has discovered when working overcome his own anxiety, below some top tips he has discovered. recognise source your anxiety. 'find source, fix problem'. some us, simple cutting off source anxiety. my case, there were certain people my life who just made me feel 'off'. i felt more insecure around them, even though i called them friends, truth, they weren't. if there people your life make feel way, brian recommends minimising amount time spend them, or cut them off completely. sometimes, it's simple finding people who make feel happy spending more time them. train, exercise or meditate. brian said: "for years, i used gym my training an outlet, so they always acted plasters temporarily healed problem. if i felt i was edge, i never dealt or asked myself who or what was making me feel way. i just went gym. i was effectively 'self-medicating' exercise. "in my opinion, it's actually best way reduce short, well long- term anxiety, but it's imperative follow step one then use training, exercise meditation ways support not just put lid over real problem." don't eat foods make your anxiety worse. brian said: "knowing how certain foods can send my body into spiral 'fight or flight' has helped support me massively over past few years. if your body intolerant or allergic certain foods, or if react certain additives, flavourings preservatives can found heavily processed food, then it's worth keeping note how feel if these ingredients feature heavily your diet. "for example, i know if i eat too much dairy, sugar or gluten, my brain will feel foggy next day i won't have same steady energy mood i normally have. everyone reacts differently certain foods ingredients, so experiment yourself. "i've largely eliminated these ingredients foods very rarely get any physiological anxiety issues anymore. if still find yourself getting edgy anxious no apparent reason - it's not about money, relationship or job just feel 'off' - then i highly recommend having look at your nutrition checking if certain foods consume causing feel way." can view fitness mindset amazon. published by rethink pres. links: brian keane fitness website: <url> ons study: <url> read more posts like visit bad witch's blog at <url> source: <url>
title: stressed? here three ways help tackle anxiety

critical infrastructure systems technologies, such global positioning system (gps), satellite operations communication, aviation, electrical power grid. extreme space weather events -- those could significantly degrade critical infrastructure -- could disable large portions electrical power grid, resulting cascading failures would affect key services such water supply, healthcare, transportation. space weather has potential simultaneously affect disrupt health safety across entire continents. successfully preparing space weather events an all-of-nation endeavor requires implementing order action plan will require federal government work across agencies develop, appropriate, enhanced innovative partnerships state, tribal, local governments; academia; non-profits; private sector; international partners. these efforts will enhance national preparedness speed creation space-weather-ready nation. sec. 3. coordination. (b) ensure accountability coordination research, development, implementation activities identified order action plan, nstc shall establish space weather operations, research, mitigation subcommittee (subcommittee). subcommittee member agencies shall conduct activities advance implementation order, achieve goals identified 2015 national space weather strategy any subsequent updates, coordinate monitor implementation activities specified action plan provide subsequent updates. sec. 4. roles responsibilities. extent permitted by law, agencies below shall adopt following roles responsibilities, which key ensuring enhanced space weather forecasting, situational awareness, space weather preparedness, continuous federal government operations during after space weather events. (a) secretary defense shall ensure timely provision operational space weather observations, analyses, forecasts, other products support mission department defense coalition partners, including provision alerts warnings space weather phenomena may affect weapons systems, military operations, or defense united states. (b) secretary interior shall support research, development, deployment, operation capabilities enhance understanding variations earth's magnetic field associated solar-terrestrial interactions. (c) secretary commerce shall: (i) provide timely accurate operational space weather forecasts, watches, warnings, alerts, real-time space weather monitoring government, civilian, commercial sectors, exclusive responsibilities secretary defense; (ii) ensure continuous improvement operational space weather services, utilizing partnerships, appropriate, research community, including academia private sector, relevant agencies develop, validate, test, transition space weather observation platforms models from research operations from operations research. (d) secretary energy shall facilitate protection restoration reliability electrical power grid during presidentially declared grid security emergency associated geomagnetic disturbance pursuant 16 u.s.c. 824o-1. (e) secretary homeland security shall: (i) ensure timely redistribution space weather alerts warnings support national preparedness, continuity government, continuity operations; (ii) coordinate response recovery from effects space weather events critical infrastructure broader community. (f) administrator national aeronautics space administration (nasa) shall: (i) implement support national research program understand sun its interactions earth solar system advance space weather modeling prediction capabilities applicable space weather forecasting; (ii) develop operate space-weather-related research missions, instrument capabilities, models; (iii) support transition space weather models technology from research operations from operations research. (g) director national science foundation (nsf) shall support fundamental research linked societal needs space weather information through investments partnerships, appropriate. (h) secretary state, consultation heads relevant agencies, shall carry out diplomatic public diplomacy efforts strengthen global capacity respond space weather events. (i) secretaries defense, interior, commerce, transportation, energy, homeland security, along administrator nasa director nsf, shall work together, consistent their ongoing activities, develop models, observation systems, technologies, approaches inform enhance national preparedness effects space weather events, including how space weather events may affect critical infrastructure change threat landscape respect other hazards. (j) heads all agencies support national essential functions, defined by presidential policy directive 40 (ppd-40) <date> (national continuity policy), shall ensure space weather events adequately addressed their all-hazards preparedness planning, including mitigation, response, recovery, directed by ppd-8 <date> (national preparedness). (k) nstc member agencies shall coordinate through nstc establish roles responsibilities beyond those identified section 4 order enhance space weather preparedness, consistent each agency's legal authority. sec. 5. implementation. (a) within 120 days date order, secretary energy, consultation secretary homeland security, shall develop plan test evaluate available devices mitigate effects geomagnetic disturbances electrical power grid through development pilot program deploys such devices, situ, electrical power grid. after development plan, secretary shall implement plan collaboration industry. taking action pursuant subsection, secretaries energy homeland security shall consult chairman federal energy regulatory commission. (b) within 120 days date order, heads sector-specific agencies oversee lifeline critical infrastructure functions defined by national infrastructure protection plan 2013 -- including communications, energy, transportation, water wastewater systems -- well nuclear reactors, materials, waste sector, shall assess their executive statutory authority, limits authority, direct, suspend, or control critical infrastructure operations, functions, services before, during, after space weather event. heads each sector-specific agency shall provide summary these assessments subcommittee. (c) within 90 days receipt assessments ordered section 5(b) order, subcommittee shall provide report findings these assessments recommendations director ostp, assistant president homeland security counterterrorism, director omb. assessments may used inform development implementation policy establishing authorities responsibilities agencies response space weather event. (d) within 60 days date order, secretaries defense commerce, administrator nasa, director nsf, collaboration other agencies appropriate, shall identify mechanisms advancing space weather observations, models, predictions, sustaining transitioning appropriate capabilities from research operations operations research, collaborating industry academia extent possible. (e) within 120 days date order, secretaries defense commerce shall make historical data from gps constellation other u.s. government satellites publicly available, accordance executive order 13642 may 9, 2013 (making open machine readable new default government information), enhance model validation improvements space weather forecasting situational awareness. (f) within 120 days date order, secretary homeland security, through administrator federal emergency management agency coordination relevant agencies, shall lead development coordinated federal operating concept associated checklist coordinate federal assets activities respond notification of, protect against, impending space weather events. within 180 days publication operating concept checklist, agencies shall develop operational plans documenting their procedures responsibilities prepare for, protect against, mitigate effects impending space weather events, support federal operating concept compatible national preparedness system described ppd-8. sec. 6. stakeholder engagement. agencies identified order shall seek public-private international collaborations enhance observation networks, conduct research, develop prediction models mitigation approaches, enhance community resilience preparedness, supply services necessary protect life property promote economic prosperity, consistent law. sec. 7. definitions. used order: (a) "prepare" "preparedness" have same meaning they have ppd-8. they refer actions taken plan, organize, equip, train, exercise build sustain capabilities necessary prevent, protect against, mitigate effects of, respond to, recover from those threats pose greatest risk security nation. includes prediction notification space weather events. (b) "space weather" means variations space environment between sun earth (and throughout solar system) can affect technologies space earth. primary types space weather events solar flares, solar energetic particles, geomagnetic disturbances. (c) "solar flare" means brief eruption intense energy or near sun's surface typically associated sunspots. (d) "solar energetic particles" means ions electrons ejected from sun typically associated solar eruptions. (e) "geomagnetic disturbance" means temporary disturbance earth's magnetic field resulting from solar activity. (f) "critical infrastructure" has meaning provided section 1016(e) usa patriot act 2001 (42 u.s.c. 5195c(e)), namely systems assets, whether physical or virtual, so vital united states incapacity or destruction such systems assets would have debilitating impact security, national economic security, national public health or safety, or any combination those matters. (g) "sector-specific agency" means agencies designated under ppd-21 <date> (critical infrastructure security resilience), or any successor directive, responsible providing institutional knowledge specialized expertise well leading, facilitating, or supporting security resilience programs associated activities its designated critical infrastructure sector all-hazards environment. sec. 8. general provisions. (a) nothing order shall construed impair or otherwise affect: (i) authority granted by law an agency, or head thereof; or (ii) functions director omb relating budgetary, administrative, or legislative proposals. (b) order shall implemented consistent applicable law subject availability appropriations. (c) order not intended to, does not, create any right or benefit, substantive or procedural, enforceable at law or equity by any party against united states, its departments, agencies, or entities, its officers, employees, or agents, or any other person. barack obama white house, <date>.

content: when he read 1992 maastricht treaty leach became convinced eu was 'a bureaucratic oligarchy, not democracy' was when he first read full text 1992 maastricht treaty leach became convinced eu was "a bureaucratic oligarchy, not democracy". he opposed idea "european constitution" would designed centralise power brussels. support grew mid-1990s british membership single currency, he became convinced "one-size-fits-all" monetary policy could not work widely differing national economies. 1998 - at time when prime minister tony blair was positioning uk join euro full-hearted support cbi many members business establishment - leach founded business sterling co-ordinate case against. lobby group gradually recruited thousand chairmen chief executives its cause gathered momentum around country until pro-euro side largely faded away. but when asked whether he had personally saved britain from dangerous fate, leach was self-effacing: "if there was credit should spread very, very broadly. i was just chairman." issue enlargement, leach remarked 'the democratic deficit ... gets worse every time there more europe' 2005 he set up open europe, think-tank dedicated scrutinising challenging every aspect european project, from minutiae financial regulation constitutional issues enlargement, which leach remarked "the democratic deficit ... gets worse every time there more europe". but his approach was constructive. having won battle against euro membership, he said, "we now want fight much longer war make something good happen." his vision was "a much more efficient europe... britain would at ease with": "neighbourly alliance" which those nations wanted share economic sovereignty those just wanted co-operation trade would equally welcome. 2016 referendum uk membership eu, leach condemned what he called "adversarial claptrap" from opposing politicians, was guarded expressing his own preference. contrast many voices warning "brexit" could bring economic disaster, open europe's research indicated impact british departure could positive or negative, depending subsequent trade deals deregulation measures - but either way was likely relatively modest scale. an interview spectator conducted february (before david cameron's "renegotiation" membership terms) leach spoke value continuing uk pressure eu reform, seemed lean towards remain. he had still made no public declaration when mid-april, while chairing an open europe debate, he suffered severe stroke. however, an email he had sent friend march was subsequently published: "we aren't ever going sacrifice our democracy, eu cannot ever develop democracy, hasn't got demos... so has exit, painful though may temporarily be." charles guy rodney leach was born dublin june 1 1934. he was educated at harrow balliol college, oxford - where he took first greats won all four latin greek verse prose composition prizes (his older brother colin having won three). he embarked an academic career, having "never given slightest thought" what he might do otherwise. was hungarian uprising 1956 jolted him into wider awareness: he helped found oxford-hungarian relief fund refugee camps, recalling later: "this was real world was revelation... here were people longing free, was deeply exciting." thereafter he decided financial career - many bright young men did era - embarked canada, where he worked brokerage investment firm greenshields montreal, under tutelage george cretzianu, former romanian finance minister who had escaped from russians. returning london, leach was recruited into nm rothschild & sons 1963 by his oxford friend jacob (now lord) rothschild, who was junior partner family banking house. partner from 1968, joint head corporate finance, leach acquired reputation master financial complexities: triumvirate leach, jacob rothschild former barrister philip (later sir philip) shelbourne took bank forefront city dealmaking, both fast-growing eurobond market mergers acquisitions. latter sphere, adviser american company leasco its bid pergamon press 1969, leach was obliged face down pergamon's owner, robert maxwell. rothschild team rightly suspected false accounting behind pergamon's reported profits - leach was invited discuss matter at maxwell's home, headington hall, near oxford. having received sinister warnings about what maxwell might capable of, leach agreed attend only basis telephone calls would made mansion at specified times - if leach did not answer them, police would called. maxwell was unperturbed by condition, appearing think quite normal - but he treated leach more respectfully thereafter. 1972 leach first came attention then taipan jardines hong kong, henry keswick, when rothschild was called defend dairy farm, local retail chain valuable property assets, against hostile takeover bid by jardines' subsidiary hong kong land. bitter battle bidder eventually prevailed, but leach extracted rich price. four years later - having become caught up tensions between jacob his cousin (sir) evelyn de rothschild, by then chairman bank - leach left rothschilds work lebanese financier edmond safra (who had been rothschilds client) his swiss-based trade development bank. but when safra sold most business 1983 american express, leach left matheson & co, london holding company jardine matheson. its lombard street office became his base operations rest his life; he was an executive director until he was past 80, squeezing his campaigning activities "between hours 6am 8am after 6pm, at weekends holiday". jardines' financial strategist, director its group companies, leach devised structure cross-shareholdings which maintain keswick family control protect group against takeover bids. he was also behind controversial transfer domicile group companies from hong kong bermuda mid-1980s their stock market listing london well hong kong, anticipation transfer sovereignty communist china. 2006 he returned rothschild fold non-executive capacity director paris orleans (now rothschild & co), holding company french british branches empire. he was member british library's board. rodney leach published europe: concise encyclopedia european union 1998. he was created life peer, lord leach fairford, 2006, having been nominated by conservative leader michael howard recognition his european campaigns: one commentator imagined tony blair eyeing list nominations muttering: "not man leach, dammit." leach was also force behind "no av" campaign which 2011 helped defeat liberal democrats' proposal replace first-past-the-post parliamentary elections "alternative vote" system proportional representation. leach was an avid competitive bridge player at portland club. he married first, 1963, felicity ballantyne, whom he had met canada. marriage was dissolved 1989 he married secondly, 1993, jessica douglas-home, widow times editor charles douglas-home. jessica had worked romanian dissidents before fall soviet empire was, rodney observed, "more revolutionary than me": was she who first urged him immerse himself small print maastricht treaty. she survives him two sons three daughters first marriage. lord leach fairford, born june 1 1934, died june 12 2016
title: rothschild passed day orlando shooting

content: headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! close look at indian governor mike pence, man announced donald trump's running mate last week, tells us few things about what counts "establishment" today's republican party. "pence so far right when comes women's lgbt issues," writes joan walsh at nation, "he makes trump look like democrat. frankly, he's smooth-talking todd akin"--the republican former u.s. representative from missouri who famously tried limit federal funding abortion women who suffered what he called "legitimate rape." congress, pence co-sponsored bill. pence also guy who began gop's ugly so far unsuccessful crusade defund planned parenthood, back 2007. "he's only one i know who has been so completely obsessed planned parenthood," planned parenthood president cecile richards said back then. "this just seems an enormous focus his." course, pence got more company tea party congress 2011, year he threatened shut down government over continued planned parenthood funding. since becoming governor 2013, pence has signed various anti-abortion bills succeeded defunding planned parenthood his state. helped lead devastating resurgence hiv/aids, since planned parenthood was one few providers hiv testing state. unfortunately, there's not much daylight between trump pence issue planned parenthood. although daughter ivanka reportedly got trump say nice things about group's women's-health work earlier year, both he pence have said if planned parenthood wants continue providing primary care women, crucial screenings breast cervical cancers, should stop providing abortions. ... also, trump has promised punish women getting abortions (and then flip-flopped); pence has actually done so. indianapolis, 30-year-old purvi patel was prosecuted using pills doctors prescribe early pregnancy termination allegedly later her term. her conviction being appealed. course, pence probably best known nationally supporting one nation's toughest so-called "religious freedom" laws, then backing down when big businesses from apple salesforce angie's list said they'd curtail commerce his state. pence says he "fixed" law, but lgbt advocates don't entirely buy it. conservatives do, however, they consider pence traitor bowing business. pence an odd choice, many reasons: he's got low approval ratings his home state faces tough reelection battle. he supports free trade opposes trump's muslim ban. indiana governor endorsed texas senator ted cruz just before state's crucial primary may, but said wishy-washy nice things about trump, too. when trump crushed cruz indiana, pence got trump train.
title: trump vp pick mike pence led crusade against planned parenthood

(i was little saddened. i wasn't interested how anakin fell how han leia got married.) then prequels were. . well. . .awful. so, news our middle age, last three would made was met excitement mixed lot anxiety. would these awful, too? would they all ewoks jar jar? would acting so bad make laugh inappropriate parts? so, some trepidation, generation viewers bought tickets ahead time see episode vii. was good. maybe great, maybe amazing, but definitely all was good. at end there was clapping rejoicing, story but also sense movie makers (disney now, not george lucas) heard fans. understood what was so genre-defining game-changing about episode iii. gave fans story, without muppets bad actors. if original movie resonated audience's priors about good evil, latest installment resonates audience's need understood heard. george lucas has criticized "retro" episode vii pandering fans. whatever. i loved it. i walked out wanted walk right back again. if you've seen movie, then can track episode vii episode iii have already realized they same (awesome) movie. there bad guy, who used good guy (kylo ren), bad guy mentor (supreme leader snoke), who trying take over galaxy under name first order. there resistance leader who has secret information (poe) who gives droid (bb-8) deliver resistance. there two young people who bump into bb-8's mission (rey finn) each have their own reasons following or wanting leave. both rey finn have parts luke han solo. rey scavenger tinkerer pilot (like han), but she obviously has higher calling force (like luke). finn moved by love (like luke), but also has self-preservation tendencies (like han). but they interesting their own right. finn fn-2187, stormtrooper. these iconic troops have been nameless faceless star wars fans now have backstory. finn was taken from his family by first order programmed fight. (his programming seems not have taken at all!) after his first battle, finn decides escape but needs pilot help him. luckily him, poe being held prisoner best pilot resistance. together, they escape, heading toward jakku, find bb-8 take secret information back resistance. after their ship disabled, finn wakes up jakku, where he meets up rey, who has befriended bb-8. after stormtroopers come calling, three take off millennium falcon (!!) get information resistance. guess what information is? map where luke skywalker has been living self-imposed exile!! so, story set parallels original lead one predict where plot going go. characters related one another, someone dies way inspires newest jedi, etc. along way we meet back up han chewbacca, even general (nee princess) leia. there many, many moments homage original, i ate them up rest audience. there lots things criticize, course. galaxy, which has many non-humanoid beings humanoid beings, seems about 2% female .00002% nonwhite. droids may more slave than robot. (we rewatched original three, even those movies, droids inconsistently feel pain, fear torture or destruction, have feelings.) many people have pointed out, best parts movie unoriginal. but i will watch again again. rey much more interesting female character than princess leia, less whiny jedi than luke. (don't get me started about hayden christensen's anakin. anakin such bad jedi, he makes finn look like great stormtrooper.) finn seems also more three-dimensional than han. i'm very interested see where plot going. where plot going? one star wars trailers has voice-over by luke (mark hamill), saying "the force strong my family. my father has it. i have it. my sister has it. have it." riff same speech luke gives leia episode vi, but last sentence added. speech never given episode vii (in fact luke doesn't speak episode). so, we assume he will eventually give speech rey, but how does rey have force? she related luke? will movies ever mention midichlorians again (no!). continued. . . .
title: family film blogging (special edition): star wars: force awakens

content: feds seize $28 million bitcoins from alleged silk road operator % readers think story fact. add your two cents. headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! james o'toole cnn money <date> bitcoin logo. federal officials announced largest-ever seizure bitcoins friday night, securing $28 million worth digital currency from alleged owner online drug marketplace silk road. bitcoin, which allows users conduct online transactions while obscuring their identities, was only currency accepted silk road. law enforcement officials arrested site's alleged proprietor, ross ulbricht, earlier month, have shuttered operation. ulbricht faces potentially lengthy prison sentence charges ranging from narcotics trafficking computer hacking money laundering. federal officials have now seized over $33.6 million worth bitcoins connection case. article was posted: saturday, <date> at 3:06 pm tags: domestic news, government corruption, money related articles < !- where we need show related articles -> source: infowars source: <url>

content: i was silent when they came ... so there was no one left help when they came me first they tortured u.s. citizen gang member ... i remained silent; i wasn't criminal then they tortured u.s. citizen, whistleblower navy veteran ... i remained silent; i wasn't whistleblower then they locked up an attorney representing accused criminals ... i remained silent; i wasn't defense attorney then they arrested young father walking his son simply because he told dick cheney he disagreed his policies ... i remained silent; i've never talked an important politician then they said an entertainer should killed because she questioned government's version an important historical event ... i remained silent; i wasn't an entertainer then they arrested people demanding congress hold president constitution ... i did not speak out; i've never protested washington then they arrested man holding sign ... i held my tongue; i've never held kind sign then they broke minister's leg because he wanted speak at public event ... i said nothing; i wasn't religious leader then they shot student taser gun arrested him asking question politician at public event ... i remained silent; i wasn't student then they started labeling virtually every innocent normal behavior marking americans "potential terrorists" ... i remained silent; i didn't want called terrorist then they threw political dissenters psychiatric wards ... i remained silent; i didn't want seen crazy then they declared they could label u.s. citizens living u.s. soil "unlawful enemy combatants" imprison them indefinitely without access any attorney ... i remained silent; i didn't want labeled an enemy then they declared they could assassinate u.s. citizens living u.s. soil without any due process law ... i remained silent; i didn't want list when they came me, everyone was silent; there was no one left speak out. inspired by poem first they came by martin niemoller, which was written about nazis. i originally wrote poem 2007. i have updated additional verses current events have unfolded.

more important than people realize, because it's substructure regime change. we think about democracy, that's word americans love use, democracy, that's how we characterize our system. but if
