content: by giovani - <url> truly happy? happiness passing feeling or state being you? tons articles (and books) have been written about how happy, there some good information out there. i have read synthesised hundreds hours research experiments here you, action-driven article. what will find some deep, life-changing stuff. if think all talk about "how happy" fluffy material common sense, change. there theory psychology called hedonic treadmill, which says great events (like winning lottery) terrible events (like losing leg) can happen your life, but after while always back your "baseline happiness". if true, then more important than trying change your external life actually improve your baseline happiness. focus article - not "feel happy" strategies. each item here concluded suggested action step. at end post will find link download pdf all them ? understanding what authentic happiness happiness feeling or state being? what its nature, what its causes? wikipedia defines happiness "a mental or emotional state well-being characterized by positive or pleasant emotions ranging from contentment intense joy". there can never be, any objective measurement happiness based external achievements. an interpretation reality, not result reality. actually, happiness such loaded term, i wonder if right one what we truly seeking. i personally prefer speak fulfillment, contentment, well-being. greeks, other hand, spoke eudamonia, "well-lived life" problem seems understanding what causes human beings continually experience state. my research self-experiments have led me believe (that) there three "kinds" happiness: personal, transpersonal, (and) transcendental. personal happiness. most people live by belief happiness simply result accumulating many pleasurable moments possible, fulfilling one's desires. money, possessions, food, fun, sex, fame, power. here both trap "living if there no tomorrow" (the hedonistic blind focus present) "living hope better tomorrow" (putting off happiness achievement future goal). problem pursuit these pleasures achievements can often painful frustrating process (that is, an unhappy process). besides, happy-feeling resulting from these achievements short-lived usually less glorious than promise (see havard psychologist daniel gilbert "miswanting" ). top that, many cases we must fight hard keep what was gained. finally, even if we those rare beings can always easily get keep what we want, without much pain associate(d) it, inevitable result after while boredom indifference. not really definition fulfilled life, right? sounds more like an ocean trouble, some islands happy feelings. verbs personal happiness are: "to get", "to feel", "to achieve". transpersonal happiness. scientific research field positive psychology, pioneered by dr. martin seligman, phd, proposes higher "zone" happiness use one's unique qualities perspective service something larger than oneself. "higher cause" can revolve around family, community, science, art, world reform, spiritual transformation, etc.here, happiness more process, continuum. path, rather than an event. because its cause larger than one's ego, so resulting joy. have look at perma model happiness learn more. verbs transpersonal happiness are: "to do", "to grow", "to impact" transcendental happiness. more uncommon view happiness, proposed by many eastern traditions, our natural state being. our true self. if natural us, why then not experience always? just like health inherent our body but disturbed by bad habits bad food, happiness inherent our heart but disturbed by negative mindsets. verbs transcendental happiness are: "to be", "to discover", "to transform". these three "kinds" not self-excluding. each one has its place can have all. ready explore what causes true well-being lasting satisfaction life? let's do this! part 1 - essential 1. discover your true values single most important element living fulfilling life understanding your true personal values, aligning existence them. by "values" i don't mean personal qualities like "honesty" "integrity" - i mean those activities & goals most consume your soul. what hungry for. those things love think about, read about, talk about, learn about. examples values: family, building your career, athletic performance, art, spirituality, travelling, being thought leader, developing your business, etc. it's more doing, not having. how discover your values? take some minutes look deeper into yourself your life, will tell where naturally focus your valuable resources (time, energy, money, attention). actually take time do this. here some guiding questions: how do spend your free time? how do spend your money? what your life most reliable, disciplined focused? what do most think about dream about? what do love learn, read about, explore? what inspires most? fast forward your life 10 years look back. proud achieving one thing. what that? elements appear repeatedly your core values. here will find your passion, your direction. they your map every single decision your life. your map happy life. such deep topic deserves post itself (and probably will get). now, learn more about core values, i highly recommend book breakthrough experience, by dr. john f. demartini, an expert field. action step: give yourself 20~30 minutes contemplate those questions discover your core 3-4 values. if busy now, put some time your calendar later ? 2. how happy? align your life your values your happiness where your values are. what we want do, what makes us alive. more your daily thoughts activities harmony your values, happier are. also one power tool coaches. now put your values order, most important ones top. examine how much juice they getting different aspects your life. how much money, time, energy spending them? they actively directing your life, your daily choices? or they being suffocated forgotten maze practicalities living other less important things? how can your authentic self more steering wheel your life? action step: understand how much your core values directing your life or not. commit making 3 simple changes increase their power. 3. leave aside unessential - art saying "no" feeling overwhelmed tasks? maybe lacking headspace, or direction life? then might have said yes many things not truly essential, or not harmony your personal values. therefore, there no space move, or not enough energy build what really meaningful you. extra project took; extra credit card; relationship keeping don't really care about; stuff bought don't really need; old habits lurking around but have no meaning anymore. when making decisions, every "yes" commitment something, closure other things. allowing something - an activity, place, person, task - occupy valuable resources your life. can produce more money, but time spent something or someone will never come back. saying "yes" anything also demands our commitment energy headspace (an increasingly rare commodity these days). inability say no actually rooted fear. fear missing out an opportunity; fear closing door we can never again reopen. but we simply cannot have all. we fail see fear actually very cause makes us close many other doors. explore more this, check out dan ariely's classic predictably irrational. "is thing i'm thinking saying 'yes' gonna supporting my core values or not?", "how decision affect my present future self?" answering these questions, from moment moment, human journey. simple terms, our life, impact, well-being, determined by what we say yes to. collective yeses nos. "no" not negative word. not aggressive. not rejection. not selfish. focus. "no" powerful word, can used powerfully. all geniuses humanity - art, sport, politics, literature, science - were saying "yes" few things, "no" everything else. they were not chasing next shining object. "i don't know key success, but key failure trying please everybody" (bill cosby)1 contemplation our finite nature, limitation, death, pushes human beings accomplish extraordinary things, live amazing lives. why many people go through near-death experiences have their life transformed. better. they stop saying yes things don't really matter them, start focusing what really important. why movement minimalism gaining traction modern society. more topic, i recommend joshua becker's blog, becoming minimalist, ted talk. foundation "happy life", therefore, discover our core values, align our life actions them, religiously say "no" all needless things not service. trust your heart your gut if feel person or activity simply not you. action step: write down 5 things want start saying "no" life. take note what losing (time, energy, money, head space) by allowing those things creep in. 4. act based creative freedom - not conditioning since birth we have been exposed so much conditioning - from our family, friends, society, media, environment. still continue bombarded by thousands messages every day. these outside voices have been heard repeated so many times they start having an independent life inside us. no wonder hard find our true voice, opposed voice other people's opinions. yet, we only find fulfilment freedom by following our own unique voice - our "personal legend", paulo coelho would have it. so what do? key discover what our core values are. process can take time mature us. taking some time alone, apart from all familiar from us, can help. meditation, travel & retreats can give us space discover ourselves. life coach can also service. according australian nurse bronnie ware, who spent many years working patients their last weeks life, top regret dying "i wish i'd had courage live life true myself, not life others expected me." your values will your rule thumb when deciding what your voice what conditioning. action step: next time feel unsure what path take, use your core values discern your true path from your conditioning. determined act based your higher good, not based what believe "should do". 5. live present, but don't hunt short-term being exclusively present-oriented or future oriented both points unbalance trap "i'll happy when..." cause unhappiness. missing or sacrificing present - beautiful nature, human relations, rest needed, peace joy being here breath - cause unhappiness. believing happiness "in future" not only risky assumption, but also betrays concept happiness state being. not achievement your goals - process living your values. but live if there no tomorrow, focus only short-term goals other extreme scale. not sustainable either. his classic book, emotional intelligence, daniel goleman describes an experiment which four-year old kids left room alone told they can have two marshmallows if they wait experimenter return from an errand. if they can't wait till then, they can have only one marshmallow, but they can have now. some kids were able hold off fifteen twenty minutes while others jumped one marshmallow - almost always within seconds. years later same kids were interviewed, goleman discovered their ability delay gratification revealed great deal about trajectory child would likely take their lives. scholar concluded "there perhaps no psychological skill more fundamental than resisting impulse." curious many times our success short-term exactly reason our failure long-term. living day by day higher direction mind, yet our feet ground, seems balance point between present future. balance between enjoying now designing future. action step: take note 5 things sacrificing your present, promise better future. then write down 5 places your life where your focus short-term goals may harming long-term direction want your life. now know what tweaks can make so can both more present, also focused right things. 6. don't chase extrinsic values while focus extrinsic life values may lead quicker satisfaction these desires, true fulfilment will not found down path. other hand, there countless testimonials people focused first "important stuff" life and, result, also got extrinsic goals met. book science motivation,why we do what we do, edward deci tells us: "the researchers found if any three extrinsic aspirations - money, fame, or beauty - was very high an individual relative three intrinsic aspirations, individual was also more likely display poorer mental health. example, having an unusually strong aspiration material success was associated narcissism, anxiety, depression, poorer social functioning rated by trained clinical psychologist...in contrast, strong aspirations any intrinsic goals - meaningful relationships, personal growth, community contributions - were positively associated well-being. people who strongly desired contribute their community, example, had more vitality higher self-esteem. when people organize their behavior terms intrinsic strivings (relative extrinsic strivings) they seem more content - they feel better about who they display more evidence psychological health." action step: review your core values. what driving life? these extrinsic values or intrinsic values? if they extrinsic, what bigger value behind them? 7. careful how feed your senses our body fed by food, water, other elements; our mind fed through ideas five speech, or drawing. perhaps when thinking deeply about some matter, or when meditating. different people access flow according their own passion. what moves artists, athletes, writers, entrepreneurs give their whole selves into their project. also one cornerstones daoist philosophy. mihaly csikszentmihalyi, author finding flow, one pioneers research, wrote: "in all activities people our study just balanced person's capacity act." expand topic, check out article blog pursuit-of-happiness. action step: what activities your life more likely find flow? how can deepen your involvement these those 326 studies, 256 (79%) found only positive associations between religiosity/spirituality well-being. some people, spirituality come through their religion; but spirituality religion different faith; not dogmatic nor ritualistic. not cult. does not limit your freedom does not make close minded. side note, there studies show benefits meditation regardless belief or religious inclination. true spirituality an invitation look deeper into your life, your values, discover your true self. exploring topic more in-depth will subject other posts. now, can start by reading some meditation quotes. action step: start looking ways develop your spirituality, deeper perspective values life. 10. master your mind buddhism other ancient traditions emphasise our mind can our greatest friend or our worst enemy. can make our life heaven or hell. "more than those who hate you, more than all your enemies, an undisciplined mind does greater harm." - buddha there no doubt about - there can no happiness while we enslaved by our own shadows. no factor seems more important our wellbeing than state our minds. yet, average person up 70% ones thoughts negative self-talk. leads emotional overload stress. "ok, i get it", i hear say, "but how control mind?". thing is, cannot control first thought arises mind any given situation - simply conditioned response. but can exercise control over second thought ones after. here lies your power (and responsibility). example, i'm sitting couch sunday afternoon thought arises "i'm lonely". whether i "accept" continue train thought ("yeah, nobody loves me...", etc.) or simply let pass, its my choice. i can also choose instead think "yes, i'm alone at moment, but its good, i need some self-space". one way leads anxiety, victimization self-pity - other these energies can empowering or disempowering. life's challenges polishing you, preparing bigger things. action step: next time challenge comes, kiss its face, learn lesson, move on. 12. expectation expecting things easy when learning something, or working my business, or trying navigate through life, will create lot frustration. if, instead, i expect things hard, i'll well prepared. if they turn out easy, i'm happy; if they turn out hard... well, no surprises here. after all, usually what worth having doesn't comes easy. similarly, hoping get lucky, accepted, have quick success, have no conflicts - all these expectations bring about pain. we'd better off just doing what we need do leaving future take care itself. while may impossible live without any expectations at all, when we learn more conservative "soft" about our expectations, we suffer less consequences their violation. keeping mind they arbitrary self-imposed, we tend have more flexibility flow. manage your expectations, will rarely disappointed. check out also create posts about subject lifehacker, huffington post tiny buddha. action step: what needless expectations imposing yourself right now? do really need them? 13. yesterday graveyard... how forget past reinvent your history victimization, remorse, guilt, regret. no doubt these unhappy feelings, they all have something common: they anchored past. what dwelling on? your past failures? betrayal? gaffe made last dinner party? something unjust happened you? past good one thing only: learning. we need reflect what has happened, learn from it, move on. your past does not define - unless allow to. not what has happened you; what choose become. mind defines you. mind creates what constantly thinks about. suddenly over thinking past doesn't sound like good idea anymore... usually pain (and not pleasure), keeps us looking back. desire "correct" past one main reasons why we get stuck it. yet desire goes against basic law nature. if we reflect deeply about how tendency hurting our present, how hindering our life here now, we will have motivation needed make decision let go stop looking back. course, if possible also helps get physically apart from places people who take back your past. another approach actually reinvent your past. yes, possible, not hallucination. fact is, past we remember what we have subjectively experienced, not raw facts. facts + our thinking/feeling. not reality, but rather our colourful description - we have power change this. if somebody did something bad us, we cannot start believing they simply didn't do (we actually can, but that's delusional); but we can change our belief about what means us. basically changes everything, because rest our life we will remember our story event, it's ending, not experience event. morty lefkoe, author best-seller re-create your life, teaches process can used reinterpret past events simple way: identify undesirable pattern name underlying belief identify source belief memory, including much sensory detail possible describe possible alternate interpretations memory realize your original belief an interpretation, not reality consciously choose reject original belief "false" consciously choose accept your reinterpretation "true" both interpretations valid. your reality will defined by one choose accept. your choice. action step: identify where your past usually get stuck in, go through reinterpretation process. 14. accept things cannot control or change whether we like or not, many things life we cannot change. we cannot change other people, nor behaviour market. other things can changed, but only colossal effort during long period time. accepting reality not passive attitude. does not make us weak. does require humility, course, but empowers us respond life wiser, more effective, way. we cannot fight all battles. so let's choose wisely what accept, what focus change. action step: struggling accept some major reality yourself or your life? what would happen if instead asking "how can i change this" asked "how can i make use this?" 15. move direction your fears yes, read right. have determination no fear must arise unmet. have obsession every fear must confronted conquered. unleashing your inner hero will deepen your life broaden your heart. fear one most instinctive human emotions. can take many idea learn how deal it. problem not fear arises. problem, if any, how respond it. yes, believe or not, have total freedom how respond. maybe hard experience it, because might not have exercised happy those bigger than their fears. how bigger than your fear? act bigger than your fear. when doubt, close your eyes take leap. don't cling something just because fear. makes prisoner. hey! fear not big deal. just some electrical impulses your brain, coupled bit chemicals running through your blood. will keep powerless while life runs by? action step: think something makes afraid. take one small step every day direction fear. it's important small step, otherwise may lose motivation. feel confidence comes from acting despite fear. gradually increase boldness your actions. 16. embrace impermanence not understanding accepting impermanence cause unhappiness. impermanence fundamental law our existence. only thing certain life: everything changes. time eats away everything, nothing remains same. your time will spent. money will gone. many things cared about will either disappear, or will no longer care about them. good news whatever negative feeling or unpleasant situation experiencing will also pass. there was time when did not exist; then shows up limited time, after goes back not existing. several ancient traditions emphasised need contemplate fleeting nature our lives, from buddha stoics (who called exercise memento mori). deeper life opens up when we understand embrace impermanence our mortality, learn its lessons. deep (and often unnoticed) fear our hearts released once we accept impermanence down our bones. result we get more focused, we freed up live more amazing life. action step: spend some time reflecting about how everything constantly changes. think something very attached to, or situation bothering you. realize too shall pass. 17. happy thoughts - choosing optimism, choosing happiness yes, wellbeing happiness matter choice. "habits thinking need not forever. one most significant findings psychology last twenty years individuals can choose way they think." - martin seligman from learned optimism wonderful book author explains difference between optimism (much vogue) "positive thinking": former learning new set cognitive skills, while later repeating "positive affirmations" yourself. skills we need learn changing our "explanatory styles", which how we chose talk ourselves when interpreting what's happening. following experiment was made two dogs. first dog slightly shocked but has lever he can push stop shocks. he quickly learns stop shocks. he's good "psychological" shape. second dog does not have lever, so he can't stop shocks. his shocks stop only when first dog hits his lever. so, effect, shocks random him. our second dog "learns" he helpless face these shocks. here's what's fascinating: dogs then moved new area taught new way avoid shocks. so, now they can both avoid shocks at will. remarkably, although first dog avoids shocks, second dog curls up corner whimpers shock - which he could have avoided - administered. he has learned helplessness. second dog may feel sorry himself. he may blame first dog. he may complain. all these disempowering. or he may learn see things differently. we condition ourselves through our own self-talk, then become prisoners our interpretations, blind reality. whether tell yourself can or can't, right. why if want create instant change your life, watching your self-language seems great place start. how describe your reality how define it, how create it. here model author proposes an optimist explanatory style: permanence - what happened likely continue? optimists think if it's bad thing it's fluke. if it's good thing, they tend think it's permanent. opposite holds true pessimist: good things flukes bad things more likely recur. - what happened likely continue? optimists think if it's bad thing it's fluke. if it's good thing, they tend think it's permanent. opposite holds true pessimist: good things flukes bad things more likely recur. pervasiveness - does reflect your whole life? "universal" or "specific"? good event, optimist more likely extend her whole life. bad event, she will tend isolate incident specific situation. opposite holds true pessimist. - does reflect your whole life? "universal" or "specific"? good event, optimist more likely extend her whole life. bad event, she will tend isolate incident specific situation. opposite holds true pessimist. personalisation - internal or external? something good happens. an optimist pats himself back (internal), thinking he did good job. if same thing happens pessimist, he more likely attribute success luck, other people's hard work, or something else outside his control (external). how we interpret events can maximise happiness energize us, or make us feel terrible. good news is: it's our power decide. an emotional intelligence skill can developed. course, many situations life call dose pessimism, caution, "defensive thinking", so our optimism should not blind us either. like anything excess, irrational optimism also harmful - though arguably less harmful than irrational pessimism. so maybe section should called "choosing balanced optimism". true optimism more reaction present than an expectation about future. not about blindly believing things will always turn out he best. violates principle managing your expectations (see point 12). true optimism about choosing interpret events positive light when they do happen. not being attached past negative talk. being open anything can happen, yet at same time confident "i can do something positive anything comes". there several studies how being optimistic positively affects physical mental health (1, 2), romantic relationships, athletic performance, career, business economy. check out article read more optimism & positive psychology, one about how happiness also deliberate choice. action step: identify three places your life having negative self-talk. how could have more empowering interpretation situation? negative self-talk based reality now, or mere learned habit? 18. wrong needing right all time can extremely limiting energy consuming. having courage vulnerable accept one's mistakes liberating. whether accept not, reality many times will wrong. by saying, "i was wrong" more often - yourself others - will find more compassion, humility flexibility. people will trust more. good always aim highest - long we understand perfection unattainable, both work relationships. nothing perfect; even earth not perfectly round. will invariably make bad decisions. understanding how often we wrong makes us more compassionate towards ourselves. we see many times we simply did best we could at time - we need educate ourselves, not punish ourselves. we will also tend criticise others less, more empathetic, which will improve our social relations. humility pays off. personally, was not easy me accept practice lesson. but once i tried few times, i started taking pleasure it. there certain unburdening heart happens, which makes worth even if only feeling. my values points view were changing by time, even something opposite, i saw contradicting myself was sign growth, not confusion or unreliability. action step: hard accept being wrong? if so, try this: look back see some opinion had now see was wrong. or maybe some bad decision. then clearly express were wrong person involved situation. depending magnitude what happened, "little" act can save relationship, company, life. 19. have some trust one qualities developing your spirituality trust something larger than yourself. call god, universe, dharma, life - doesn't matter. it's not about whimsical expectation things will happen according your preference, but faith things will happen favor your greater good. it's conviction that, if put your best foot forward, universe will respond. does one really need trust? no. but life more beautiful it. trust something larger accomplishes four important things: makes optimistic (section 17) decreases your worries doubts, allowing forget about future focus more present forces accept things cannot change takes out your little world less prone mental masturbation "what if..." there also scientific evidence trust makes us happy. here podcast episode where one my guests speaks about value surrender. action step: time take leap faith somewhere your life? how would your feelings actions different if had more trust? 20. dare disagree "it's always better at bottom ladder want climb than top one don't" marc angel chernoff. free yourself from crowd mentality. lion. will not find happiness life sheep - at most comfort. lion finds his own path, or carves one out if none found. sheep follows beaten road. lion walks alone if needed, fearless. sheep fearful moves herds. lion roars loud clear. sheep's sound weak hesitant. lion rests deep, confident he can handle any challenge. sheep worried about tomorrow. lion makes news. sheep reads news. lion creates innovates. sheep follows standards repeats patterns. lion will fight, even though wounded. sheep will run, even before fight. "be light unto yourself", buddha said. sing your own song. world needs your unique gift, presence, perspective. no need apologise your existence your dreams. action step: being sheep any place your life? awaken lion within. 21. money matters, but not really what can money do you, how much do really need? it's huge topic. but purposes post we can say there broadly three types attitudes when comes money: it's not important (and other limiting beliefs) it's extremely important reason my efforts money resource, its important my life, but it's not measure success or happiness first two will make make suffer. balanced point view will set right path. there plenty research concluding money does matter, but once certain threshold comfort achieved (some studies suggest 60~70k year), matters less less overall wellbeing person. after basic needs life oneself one's family met, continue chase money more cause dissatisfaction than fulfillment (refer point number 6 post), especially if driven by peer comparison pressure consumerism. most valuable thing money can buy time, how use your time will determine how happy are. once point comfort has been reached, feeling happy what we have, focusing our efforts life's intrinsic values, seems best use money. also, experiments show spending others can boost our happiness more than spending ourselves (see also greatergood sciencemag). action step: discover what your attitude about money. holding any limiting beliefs, or over-focused accumulating wealth? 22. do your inner work all these insights have one thing common: they require some inner work. these keys worthless unless actually use them. will need put some thought about yourself your life, develop more self-awareness, then decide make change. most people not taking path - they simply looking patches. solve one problem at its root will never need solve again. if keep coming back same problems, same level, then maybe something not right. no shortcuts here. no silver bullet. just pains personal growth - like giving birth your new self. designed by you! results pay off big time. secret here fall love process growth. feeling freeing oneself from old shackles. enjoying virtues we developing. action step: create some space your life self-awareness personal development. nothing will make bigger impact than investment yourself. think what could your first step journey. conclusion wow, actually read whole post! i'm grateful your company ? content: 1. dairy an allergen lactose intolerance trigger 2. most people actually lactose intolerant don't know 3. dairy weakens bones, can lead osteoporosis linked cancer 4. dairy products particularly susceptible radiation contamination (naturalnews) dairy foods make delicious satisfying complement many people's diets. however, there large body evidence suggests most people's bodies just not well equipped digest process dairy-based foods beverages (unless happen sherpa from tibetan highlands). and, our environment gets more polluted, reasons reduce dairy consumption increase rather than stay same. here some convincing reasons reduce or even eliminate dairy from your diet:consumption dairy has varying effects different people. some people so sensitive dairy ingesting even small amount can fatal if they have anaphylaxis, severe, potentially fatal allergic reaction can result rashes, swelling, hives, itching, trouble breathing, wheezing or even loss consciousness. separate category from allergenics people who lactose intolerant. lactose intolerance happens when person lacking lactase, an enzyme which breaks down lactose sugars dairy. without lactase, person cannot break down digest dairy foods may experience bloating, cramps, gas diarrhea.most people world actually lactose intolerant but unaware it. estimated 75% world's citizens generally lack lactase enzyme needed break down lactose into simpler sugar forms glucose galactose, which body can process effectively. most 20th century, has been generally accepted almost all humans could break down lactose, but was proven incorrect by research conducted during 1960s which found most people lose lactase enzyme after being weaned children, usually between ages two five. small percentage humans, such tibetan sherpas their relatives, do retain lactase enzyme throughout adulthood, due evolutionary adaptivity.most us have been deceived by usda's nutritional guidelines into believing dairy healthy part balanced diet, "diets rich milk dairy products help build maintain bone mass throughout lifecycle may reduce risk osteoporosis ." these statements unfortunately misleading even dangerous. studies have found highest rates osteoporosis occur countries high consumption animal products. research suggests that, rather than building strong bones teeth, dairy products prevent calcium from being absorbed body.high quality plant-based foods, such broccoli, kale collard greens, provide much more easily absorbable calcium than dairy. these should used place dairy healthy sources calcium.there many other convincing reasons avoid dairy besides risk osteoporosis. research has shown dairy consumption linked cancer, heart disease diabetes.ever since fukushima disaster 2011, researchers have been testing foods vegetables radioactivity. department nuclear engineering at uc berkeley has been taking radiation samples since fukushima meltdown. they have tested both raw milk store-bought, have detected radioactive isotopes cesium-134 137 (cs-134, cs-137). alarming when consider dairy "radioactive indicator" our food supply. dairy good indicator radiation, because cows consume grass, food crops water supplies. simple terms, when dairy starts testing positive radioactivity, it's an indication radioactive contamination entire food supply.zach c. miller was raised from an early age believe power value healthy-conscious living. he later found himself talent writing, only made sense put two & two together! he has written published articles about health & wellness other topics <url> here naturalnews. he holds bachelor's degree applied science.

content: martin elvis an astrophysicist recently took internet hopefully spread word public those scientific community about pressing matter. he claims high costs 'flagship' missions keeping other important crucial missions stuck 'drawing board.' he says he worried because golden age we have been seems coming an end. sure, no golden age lasts forever but we putting an end one far too soon. there seems good reason behind what he saying. elvis wrote scientific american follows: our early successes came from looking through new windows across vast range wavelengths invisible naked eye. first radio, x-ray, ultraviolet infrared telescopes were small, but everything we saw through them was new mysterious. next generation telescopes leaped forward capabilities, leading discoveries neutron stars, black holes, radiation left over from big bang, dark matter, dark energy, dark energy, exoplanets ... list goes on. but greater power came at cost--literally since each new generation telescopes carried price tag several times higher than one before. today, single telescope can now take almost full decade's worth nasa's budget "big astronomy." james webb space telescope (jwst), now scheduled launch next year, takes prize at about $8 billion. glory our golden age has been we can access whole electromagnetic spectrum at same time. discovery gravitational waves from merger two neutron stars perfect example: ground-based detectors spotted these ripples spacetime, but follow-up observations gamma-ray, x-ray visible-light telescopes gave us far more complete understanding how event unfolded. ideally, we need several comparably sensitive "flagship" telescopes, par jwst, they need flying at same time. yet such flagships only designed last about five years (although can often stretched 10). when infrared-sensitive jwst flies, will 10 100 times more powerful than its predecessors, hubble spitzer space telescopes. but if new flagships cost much jwst, will decade before even one can launched. by time jwst itself will likely its last legs. so every discovery made by webb telescope will take over decade follow up. by then, we'll have forgotten what was we wanted know first place. advances astronomy will slow snail's pace. elvis says way we respond crises like make huge difference how things go down. he noted we do not have simply accept this. we can respond different manner change outcome. he believes new program needs put place should one requiring multiple new missions. can read his full article by clicking here or video below. what do think about all this?
title: astrophysicists believe golden age astronomy could over
tags: martin elvis, scientific american, astrophysicist, end, crucial, pressing matter, interesting, interest, death golden age, astronomy

"consistent international law, police uk prohibited from using firearms except where strictly necessary after considering non-violent less lethal options." sort shoot-first-ask-questions-later mentality probably has something do low 0.33% conviction rate mentioned earlier... fact only 4 states have laws mandate police have attempt other means incapacitating suspect (when reasonable) before using deadly force... fact police spend 7 times many hours training fire weapon opposed learning de-escalate situation or use baton. fact, police spend more time training shoot than... any other single item their training schedule. cases where person was armed firearm, 1 out 5 were not threatening anyone. only 43% all cases was person posing threat gun; theoretically, majority these cases could have been resolved without use deadly force. number officers killed at lowest 50 years, at 44 shot (more, 47 exact, were killed vehicle crashes), would not seem they under any increased threat their own personal safety...

content: during ceremony mark 72nd anniversary hiroshima anniversary japan's prime minister made an effort call world peace. according shinzo abe japan will doing all can work towards eternal world peace. may know, japan has undergone two atomic bombs both dropped by us. first hiroshima second just few days later nagasaki; atomic bomb hiroshima detonated around 600 meters above city killed over 140,000. while did effectively end second world war was huge price japan never willing pay again. sadly, commemoration was overshadowed by threat has been posed by north korea. last month, north korean military tested two intercontinental ballistic missiles major us cities like chicago within range attack. according japan times, around 50,000 people attended ceremony included representatives from 80 nations. if any kind nuclear bomb was dropped today would cause much more damage than hiroshima bomb combined one dropped nagasaki. so far, japan has been only country endure nuclear attack, but changed country forever. kazumi matsui during ceremony mentioned above asked central government during time help making treaty banning nuclear weapons. during his speech, matsui demanded government give more assistance compassion elder hibakusha well many others also suffering mentally physically from effects radiation. japan times reports city officials claim 'many others' reference was referring people who were affected by march 2011 triple core meltdown at fukushima no. 1 nuclear power plant. during ceremony another japanese male, hiroshima native masaharu masuda offered prayer his parents who experienced bombing, he does every year. masuda says he disappointed by japanese government's response nuclear ban treaty worries world losing interest hiroshima's message. being said, shinzo abe defends decision by saying more realistic approach needed order reach goal living world without nuclear weapons. devastating events occurred at hiroshima nagasaki should never forgotten message comes remembering should shared world wide. something can happen anywhere at anytime. we not toys our world leaders should not playing god. how do feel about all where do stand controversy surrounding nuclear weapons? i one see no place them world, wouldn't great wake up each day without possibility nuclear bomb massacring all your friends family? heart breaking people each country must suffer because their governments cannot get along properly.
title: japan vows never declare war ever again calling world free nuclear weapons

content: woman who flipped off trump's motorcade was fired her behavior headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! woman made infamous flipping off president donald trump's motorcade says she was fired from her job her childish behavior. juli briskman said marketing company bosses called her gave her boot. but, nonetheless, 50-year-old says she has no regrets about flipping off president's motorcade. briskman was cycling virginia last month when she offered gesture what she described "gut reaction" donald trump's policies. "he was passing by my blood just started boil," she told huffington post. "i'm thinking, daca (aka, "dreamers," children illegal immigrants who were allowed stay united states) recipients getting kicked out. he pulled ads open enrollment obamacare. only one-third puerto rico has power. i'm thinking, he's at damn golf course again." photographer traveling presidential motorcade snapped briskman's picture image quickly spread across news outlets social media. many hailed briskman hero, some saying she should run 2020 election; while others called her disrespectful, emotionally driven, childish. "i flipped off motorcade number times," briskman added. but her bosses didn't find her little stunt all entertaining, or accordance how company perceives manner which an employee should conduct themselves or out workplace. briskman had been working marketing communications specialist virginia-based federal contractor, akima, six months. she thought best detail human resources department she was now infamous being emotionally unstable flipping off president. all online fuss around her actions, company would have likely found out about her antics anyway. bosses called her into meeting after she ratted herself out, she said. "they said, 'we're separating from you,'" briskman told huffington post. "'basically, cannot have lewd or obscene things your social media.' so they were calling flipping him off obscene." unfortunately briskman, that's fairly common among companies. most want their employees behave manner befitting company (including social media), flipping off president probably didn't make akima look all great. one would expect exact same reaction from boss should person have been fired flipping off president obama's motorcade. she said company was displeased she had used image her profile picture twitter facebook bosses told her using image violated social media policy could hurt company's reputation government contractor. briskman said she pointed out her social media pages do not mention her employer. she also tried shift blame when she said another employee had written profane insult about someone facebook, but had been allowed keep his job after deleting post being reprimanded. unfortunately, briskman cannot simply "delete" what she did considering photo went viral; but it's oddly amusing she tried throw fellow employee under bus her misdeeds. virginia, however, has "at will" employment laws, meaning private-sector employers can fire anyone any reason. suddenly, emotionally unstable 50-year-old mother two found herself looking new job. briskman, who votes democratic (big surprise), said she planned look new job an advocacy group she believes in, such planned parenthood or people ethical treatment animals (peta). seems about right democrat. advocate slaughter innocent human beings while saving all animals. article has been contributed by shtf plan. visit <url> alternative news, commentary preparedness info. source: <url>
title: woman who flipped off trump's motorcade was fired her behavior

content: gold prices rallied $10 per ounce from yesterday's fresh 5-month lows against dollar asian trade wednesday, only lose half bounce london traders looked today's key us monetary policy decision from federal reserve. us inflation data due later wednesday, just before us fed's widely-expected quarter-point hike interest rates, new data morning put germany's consumer-price index 1.8% higher november from same month 2016. extended 2017's run strongest inflation germany since 2012. gold priced dollars retreated $1241 per ounce, only $5 above tuesday's low, world stock markets failed follow wall street up yet more new all-time highs. silver prices tested last week's 5-month low at $15.65 per ounce, losing some 2% 2017 date versus dollar. brent crude meantime rose near monday's 2-year highs above $64 per barrel key pipeline from north sea's forties oil field remained shut repairs. natural gas prices europe's wholesale spot market traded near 4-year highs. "the outlook inflation likely remain source concern 2018," says edward bonham carter , vice-chairman ps48 billion ($64bn) uk asset managers jupiter. "there question mark over how long wage growth can remain subdued countries like uk us, labour markets being so tight." average weekly wages uk rose 2.3% 12 months october, new data said wednesday. but inflation cost living rising 3.1%, real wages - when adjusted inflation - held more than 3 pence pound below their all-time peak march 2008. major government bond prices slipped wednesday, edging yield offered new buyers higher. ahead fed decision, 10-year us treasury yields touched 2.42% per annum, highest since late october. betting also grew fed will surprise markets half-point hike ceiling 1.75%, pricing possibility at odds more than 1-in-8 - some three times likelihood implied by fed funds futures market time last month. "on long-term basis, shift business cycle leads us expect commodities outperform other asset classes , even policy makers forced hike rates," says new commodities note from us investment bank london bullion market maker goldman sachs. "the demand backdrop today now even stronger than year ago." now forecasting return nearly 10% from commodities 2018 - up from 4% forecast october - "there no evidence mass exodus from gold" favor crypto-currency bitcoin, goldman sachs' analysts add, pointing solid investor holdings gold-backed exchange-traded trust funds, currently highest since spring 2013 saw gold's sharpest price drop three decades. "bitcoin attracting more speculative inflows," goldman says, calling sources demand gold an investment hedge "vastly different" bitcoin spot prices overnight set fresh all-time highs above $17,600 - gain 2,168% from time last year. "platinum [has been] falling significantly more sharply than other precious metals," says daily commodities note from german financial services group commerzbank, pointing industrially-valuable metal's fresh 22-month lows at $870 per ounce. "the price differential gold widened around $365 again - biggest gap two months - gap [with gasoline autocatalyst metal] palladium increased $135.
title: 2018 inflation 'concerns' see gold price rally before fed rate rise

content: magnesium right doses completely reverses depression: breakthrough study % readers think story fact. add your two cents. headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! magnesium already known by many tremendous booster health. contributes sound sleep, helps digestion constipation, relieves muscle aches, even improves heart health migraine headaches - but here's shocker: magnesium small doses leads an astonishing reversal depression. what magnesium why do we need it? magnesium one most important elements human body. micronutrient mineral involved thousands biochemical processes crucial proper functioning cardiovascular, alimentary, endocrine, osteoarticular systems, but oddly, seems absolutely vital regulating our mood levels happiness. breakthrough study conducted by researchers at larner college medicine at university vermont published plos one has found just 248mg magnesium per day leads an about-face depression symptoms study subjects. "new clinical research results show magnesium effective at addressing symptoms safer easier wallet than prescription therapies," reports science daily. mounds research proving we need magnesium combat depression research kind regarding magnesium isn't new, but stands reinforce what nutritionists, health coaches, even some psychologists have been stating decades. another study states about magnesium depression: "anxiety related conditions most common affective disorders present general population lifetime prevalence over 15%. magnesium (mg) status associated subjective anxiety, leading proposition mg supplementation may attenuate anxiety symptoms." study explains that: "after adjusting all potential confounders, strength association very low magnesium intake depression was statistically significant (rr = 1.16; 95% ci, 1.06-1.30)." or how about study which states daily consumption 500 mg magnesium: ". . . tablets >=8 wk by depressed patients suffering from magnesium deficiency leads improvements depression status magnesium levels." so, while not all studies agree exact amount magnesium we need each day combat depression, they repeat over over hundreds additional studies, depleted magnesium levels contribute depression. why we're all magnesium deficient depleted soil why so many us magnesium deficient, aside from fact many vital micronutrients minerals we need have been raped from soil via industrial farming practices, by adding non-organic, toxic chemical fertilizers herbicides very soil which must grow our food? too much sugar we also eat too much sugar. coincidence? sugar industry has been hiding effects sugar us decades - one those effects sugar eats up our magnesium stores. refined sugar causes waste most vitamin minerals body, mainly b-vitamins, potassium, magnesium, zinc manganese. sugar raises co2 levels blood, which causes go bicarbonate stores which buffer it, causing depletion minerals like magnesium. stress another culprit stress - both mental physical stress, its related continuous flow adrenaline, uses up our magnesium stores rapidly. adrenaline affects heart rate, blood pressure, vascular constriction muscle contraction-- actions all demand steady supplies magnesium smooth function, without can guess what happens. we also require magnesium create serotonin, one "happy hormones" which prevents depression. stress causes less serotonin created, replaces cortisol other stress hormones. stress depression inextricably linked. without enough magnesium we haven't got chance at fighting depression naturally. detoxification magnesium powerful detoxifier. removes everything from heavy metals, glyphosate other herbicides from our bodies, well thousands environmental toxins metabolic toxins. if we become overly toxic, due lack magnesium, we more likely depressed brain suffers from inflammation cannot overcome. any wonder we suffer from following additional diseases, aside from depression, all which linked magnesium deficiency? gastrointestinal disorders: prolonged diarrhea, crohn's disease, malabsorption syndromes, celiac disease, surgical removal portion intestine, intestinal inflammation due radiation may all lead magnesium depletion. renal disorders (magnesium wasting): diabetes mellitus long-term use certain diuretics (see drug interactions) may result increased urinary loss magnesium. multiple other medications can also result renal magnesium wasting. chronic alcoholism: poor dietary intake, gastrointestinal problems, increased urinary loss magnesium may all contribute magnesium depletion, which frequently encountered alcoholics. age: several studies have found elderly people have relatively low dietary intakes magnesium. intestinal magnesium absorption tends decrease age urinary magnesium excretion tends increase age; thus, suboptimal dietary magnesium intake may increase risk magnesium depletion elderly. how much magnesium do i need where can i get it? so how much magnesium should take? general dosage recommendations range from about 3 10 milligrams per pound body weight. experiment supplement you'll know exactly how much need. can also consume natural sources magnesium which can found foods like: spinach chard almonds greek yogurt black beans avocado coriander salmon pumpkin seeds yogurt or kefir figs dark chocolate banana cashews goat cheese artichokes [more...] philosophers stone - selected views from boat <url> source: <url>

content: vietnam tilting toward china? xuan loc doan when he traveled china state visit october 2016, philippine president rodrigo duterte was grandly received by beijing. nguyen phu trong, general secretary communist party vietnam (cpv), was treated much same manner during his official trip china last week. yet, while mr trong's visit was aimed at developing stronger ties china, does not mean communist leadership hanoi pursuing duterte-like pivot beijing. closer ties beijing trong's four-day trip, which started january 12, was his first china since being re-elected cpv's leader at its 12th national congress january 2016 his first foreign tour 2017. he went beijing high-ranking delegation included four politburo members charge four important departments vietnam's one-party regime - namely central propaganda, foreign affairs, national defense public security. during visit, hanoi beijing reached wide range agreements aimed at strengthening cooperation between two ruling parties two communist neighbors various fields at many levels. trong's outing was followed by recent notable trips asian juggernaut by other vietnamese top officials - including prime minister nguyen xuan phuc dinh huynh, cpv's permanent secretary, september october 2016, respectively. mr huynh, an influential politburo member, tipped succeed trong if 72-year old leader chooses step down near future. all these journeys suggest hanoi attaching greater importance its cooperation beijing adopting more friendly posture toward latter than about six or seven months ago. combination factor may contribute change. one these fact china vietnam's closest neighbor, sharing not only land sea borders but also many political economic similarities former. world's most populous country also vietnam's biggest trading partner. given all these, coupled vietnam's power asymmetry vis-a-vis its giant neighbor, country's stability - perhaps cpv's survival - steadying its ties beijing always priority hanoi. chinese leaders' current charm diplomacy also influencing hanoi's posture. mr trong was first foreign leader china received 2017. he was given red-carpet welcome upon his arrival at beijing international airport an official welcoming ceremony full honors at great hall people beijing january 12. five seven members all-powerful standing committee politburo communist party china (cpc), including president xi jinping premier li keqiang, held talks him. mr phuc was given similar treatment when he toured china last september. warm reception chinese leaders extended their vietnamese "comrades brothers" indicates beijing also highly valuing hanoi its relations latter. this, return, increasing vietnam's trust - or at least, decreasing its mistrust - beijing encouraging develop tighter ties china. seems tensions suspicion caused by china's actions recent years, notably its placement its huge oil rig, hs-981, vietnam's exclusive economic zone 2014, have now eased. overt overtures made toward beijing by several regional countries, particularly malaysia philippines, another defining factor. last november, malaysian prime minster najib razak made six-day trip china. during visit, which was intended elevate their relationship "greater heights", kuala lumpur beijing signed many new agreements, including malaysia's first major defense deal china. two weeks before that, president rodrigo duterte also made landmark trip beijing, where he eventually solemnly announced his "separation from us" his "dependence" china, after months publicly denouncing washington praising beijing. malaysia's turn toward beijing especially philippines' dramatic tilt away from its long-standing most important ally china's orbit somehow influenced rethink hanoi. like vietnam, malaysia philippines have outstanding territorial disputes china south china sea. years, they were among region's most vocal critics their northern neighbor's expansive claims aggressive actions resource-rich strategically vital water. they all favored multilateral approaches maritime disputes. hanoi supported philippines's south china sea arbitration welcomed its landmark legal victory against china last july. duterte's wholehearted embrace china, which resulted his side-lining july ruling agreeing enter bilateral talks beijing prompted vietnam soften its posture improve relations china. last but not least, donald trump's shock rise american presidency also key reason behind hanoi's current accommodating posture toward beijing. under obama administration, vietnam america edged remarkably closer each other. their stronger ties were strengthened by - manifested - many key developments agreements. prominent among these mr trong's unprecedented trip washington 2015, president obama's milestone visit vietnam 2016, during which he officially ended america's decades-old arms embargo its former war foe, vietnam's enthusiastic response america's asia pivot us-led tpp. vietnam's strong economic strategic ties us have been jeopardy following trump's election victory. faced imminent collapse tpp other uncertainties about america's relations asia vietnam under trump, hanoi relatively readjusting its foreign policy improving its ties beijing can seen part such recalibration. but not duterte-like shift yet, while becoming more receptive beijing, hanoi not bandwagoning latter; because many reasons. one these concerns vietnam's economic imbalance china. though has dropped recently, vietnam's trade deficit world's second biggest economy remains enormous. according its general statistics office (gso), 2016, vietnam exported (us)$21.8 billion goods world's largest trading country imported $49.8 billion from it. means had trade deficit $28 billion china last year. years, hanoi has asked beijing help balance bilateral trade by creating better conditions vietnamese goods enter chinese market. reported his talk nguyen phu trong, xi jinping promised china will work harder make two countries' trade relations grow faster become more balanced. whether vietnam's companies their goods provided greater access china following trong's visit remains seen. yet, any case, will take years or decades, if ever, vietnam balance its trade china. reason - order avoid economic overdependence its giant neighbor sustain its economic development - vietnam needs good relations its other major trading partners, notably european union us, which has enjoyed huge trade surplus recent years. 2016, vietnam exported us$34 billion (in goods) eu, its third largest trading partner, us$38.1 billion us. america vietnam's biggest export market second largest trader, while unclear how donald trump will view approach his country's relations vietnam, certain hanoi will try its best sustain improve its ties washington. another reason why vietnam seeking better relations us other powers, including japan india, its unresolved maritime disputes china. during trong's china visit, both sides pledged manage maritime differences avoid any acts may complicate situation escalate tensions south china sea. nevertheless, after "candidly" exchanging their views issue, they could not yet accept each other's main position. according report by vov, vietnam's national radio broadcaster, his talk his chinese counterpart, trong "asserted vietnam's consistent stance persistently dealing dispute east sea [vietnam's name south china sea] by peaceful measures compliance international law, including 1982 united nations convention law sea (unclos), respect diplomatic legal processes." contrast, manifested by its vehement objection philippines' arbitration case, beijing has stringently opposed any legal approach resolve disputes. instead, has forcibly insisted bilateral negotiations. their joint communique mentioned neither these two positions. given china's expansive claims its past recent actions south china sea, vietnam does not expect - though strongly hopes - beijing will willingly accept peaceful solution dispute based principles international law, including unclos. why has hedged - continues hedge - against any aggressive move by china by forging strong ties global regional powers, notably those also concerned about beijing's hegemonic ambitions. supported by fact whilst trong was holding talks chinese leaders beijing, hanoi nguyen xuan phuc received john kerry. latter's visit might not have major impact future us-vietnam cooperation. yet, his talk outgoing us secretary state, vietnamese premier expressed his delight at achievements us-vietnam relations vietnam's desire reinforce bilateral ties. shows vietnamese leadership really values its relationship washington. just day after trong returned from china, hanoi received shinzo abe. their separate meetings japanese prime minister, southeast asian country's top four leaders - party chief, state president, prime minister parliament chairwoman - all affirmed hanoi's desire deepen economic strategic ties japan. his part, during two-day visit, mr abe pledged provide vietnam six new coastguard patrols. patrol vessels, worth $338 million, were part $1-billion loan tokyo offered hanoi. vietnam-japan relations have significantly advanced recent years mainly due their shared concerns over china's maritime ambitions actions. such apprehensions have also brought vietnam closer india, china's other key regional rival. six months ago, before phuc's china trip, hanoi hosted prime minister narendra modi. during landmark visit, first official trip vietnam by an indian prime minister since 2001, two countries elevated their "strategic partnership" "comprehensive strategic partnership" new delhi agreed provide vietnam $500 million defense loan. all these demonstrate while may prioritize relations beijing, hanoi also seeking stronger ties other powers, notably us, japan india, counterbalance china, both economically strategically. also evident vietnamese leadership not overtly leaning toward beijing submitting latter's maritime position president duterte has done. following duterte's china visit last october, during which he publicly promised shift his country's allegiance from washington beijing, some international relations experts, notably those from china, predicted america's other asian partners, such vietnam, may follow suit. ahead trong's visit last week, an article global times, spin-off people's daily, cpc's mouthpiece, also suggested shift diplomacy by philippine leader "sets good example other southeast asian countries, including vietnam." judging by mr trong's assertion vietnam's maritime position his talk chinese leader other diplomatic strategic moves recently taken by hanoi, apparent vietnamese leaders not following mr duterte's steps or "example". instead, they remain firmly committed their long-held foreign policy independence, diversification multilateralization has enabled vietnam develop good - generally fruitful - relations many countries, including all world's major powers region's countries. <url>
title: vietnam tilting toward china?

content: potentially explosive details revealed fusion gps co-founder's testimony transcript % readers think story fact. add your two cents. headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! week, house intelligence committee agreed release transcripts from <date> testimony glenn simpson, co-founder fusion gps. fusion gps, we all know, research firm employed gather research donald trump during 2016 election cycle - first by conservative news site, washington free beacon, then picked up by clinton campaign. there's been lot controversy surrounding dossier produced through those efforts. some details have been proven, some disproved, others remain unsubstantiated. whatever case, republican lawmakers insist an unsubstantiated dossier was sole impetus ongoing probe into russian interference 2016 election, well possible collusion by trump's team, they want investigation shut down. democrats, predictably, want push further, desperate prove they didn't make bad decision by installing hillary clinton their hand-picked candidate presidency. then there those who standing between, suspicions, maybe some doubts, but who ultimately want hear everything get truth. would where i'm at, actually. speaking everything, what do released transcripts simpson's testimony reveal? keeping mind was simpson speaking about what his firm suspected, transcripts show there was suspicions something beyond just an election. "those transcripts reveal serious allegations trump organization may have engaged money laundering russian nationals," representative adam schiff said. may have. honestly, rumors trump his organization being neck-deep dealings russian mob have been around years. these aren't campaign-generated accusations. talk longtime residents new york new jersey get impression it's badly kept secret. so what brought simpson his company suspect such nefarious activities? his testimony, simpson said his firm closely examined sales condominiums trump properties new york, miami, panama city toronto. "there were lot real estate deals where couldn't really tell who was buying property," simpson said. "and sometimes properties would bought sold, they would bought one price sold loss shortly thereafter, really didn't make sense us." "we saw patterns buying selling we thought were suggestive money-laundering," he continued. trump organization's chief counsel, alan garten, claims properties referenced by simpson were simply properties trump had licensed his name to, rather than having any substantial interest in. "these accusations completely reckless unsubstantiated multitude reasons," garten said. "these issues have nothing do scope investigation" by house intelligence committee, garten said phone interview. "but it's not surprising minority (democrats) would focus given they've found absolutely no evidence collusion." he's not wrong. i don't think ongoing russia probe was meant target potential criminal activity, such money laundering. i do believe, however, if money laundering or any other criminal activity swept up ongoing investigation, could certainly go motive. simpson's testimony also revealed suspicions russia sought infiltrate u.s. politics through powerful lobbies, such national rifle association. i mentioned situation earlier week. they also attempted influence groups promote independence texas california. "they seem have made very concerted effort get nra," simpson said, according transcript. so where do we go from here, given information? we keep digging. shouldn't considered partisan issue. should raise enough concerns responsible american citizens want know everything, before making decision. post potentially explosive details revealed fusion gps co-founder's testimony transcript appeared first redstate. source: <url>
title: potentially explosive details revealed fusion gps co-founder's testimony transcript

content: mark levin has done nation great service. he wrote new book. it's called plunder deceit: big government's exploitation young people future. an investigative author, i spend my time combing through troves data, reams financial transactions, stacks inter-governmental communiques, all an effort unearth fact-patterns self-dealing cronyism, malfeasance graft. my work zoomed in, specific, granular. conservative movement needs its sleuths. but what i love about levin's plunder deceit its philosophical breadth panoramic sweep. powered by intellectual titans like edmund burke, alexis de tocqueville, james madison, levin urges young people embark upon creation "new civil rights movement," one snaps manacles statist power embraces an intellectual economic freedom excites animates moral imagination. best all, levin respects young readers enough shoot straight them: road serfdom breezy; march liberty painstaking. yet, he reminds us, fruits latter far eclipse former. "it nature younger people today passively live let live conform their second-class standing; or worse, if inspired, unite around distractive or self-destructive causes," writes levin. "but right cause now nothing short self-preservation. there can no doubt new civil rights movement new generation activists, which must challenge tyranny status quo, will met entrenched resistance, resulting unease, discomfiture, risk, ridicule. small price pay freedom justice." amen! constitution always his guide, levin explains "the rising generation" why nation's founding bedrock document precious rare. president ronald reagan put it, constitutions most governments, "the government tells people those countries what they're allowed do. our constitution, 'we people' tell government what can do." that's difference worth fighting protecting. levin's book shows us how. authentic, sagacious, written philosophical tenor sometimes soars operatic heights, plunder deceit an important work read by all bequeathed america's rising generation.
title: review: 'plunder deceit' by mark levin
meta_description: mark levin has done nation great service. he wrote new book. it's called plunder deceit: big government's exploitation young people future.

"the spiritual beginnings past history being eliminated, its spiritual power exhausted... all usual categories thought form life most "advanced", "progressive", even "revolutionary" people 19th 20th centuries hopelessly outdated have lost all meaning present especially future". according berdyaev's observations, transition new middle ages, just same previous transition an "old" middle ages, accompanied by noticeable expansion old societies indiscernible addition new ones. "individualism has eliminated all its possibilities new history, there no longer any energy left it... end spirit individualism end new history... liberalism, democracy, parliamentarianism, constitutionalism, legal formalism, humanitarian morals, rationalist empirical philosophy all offspring an individualistic spirit, humanitarian self-assertiveness, they all dying away, they all losing their former importance... there much ontologically real about stock exchanges, banks money, about monstrous factories producing useless objects or weapons destroying life, about superficial luxuries, speeches by parliamentarians lawyers, about newspaper articles? there much real about growth insatiable demands?" russian philosopher noted christianity had previously played unifying role at least substantial proportion mankind. its very existence "signified an escape from pagan nationalism particularism". at end new history, "we once again seeing before us an unfettered world pagan particularism, inside which there deadly battle destruction taking place". however, many berdyaev's ideas do not seem so pertinent these days; would obviously wrong place an equals sign between time which he wrote beginning 21st century. although turns historical spiral linked each other, each one also unique, since new middle ages has already taken place, then imitation berdyaev might possible call trend our times newest middle ages. one most noticeable features period, example, emergence various complex networks, not just networks an information-technology sociological nature, but also those encompassing relations between states. strategies using network warfare control nations extremely popular washington. pentagon, particular, has officially adopted new military doctrine net-centric warfare aimed at "superior knowledge" "information dominance". (1) at same time, our internationally-networked world its apparent independence individual centres power which are, fact, incorporated into more complex hierarchical relations interdependencies surprisingly reminds one, an ontological sense, world middle ages. particular, system multilayered vassalage forming before our very eyes which there will no longer supreme "liege lord" before (because he cannot does not want do it), interfering literally everything do rulers his area dominance principle "a vassal my vassal not my vassal". washington understands both financially physically impossible delve into particulars all 200 world powers, but exactly what they have been trying do there so far increasing amounts effort. simpler choose half dozen or dozen trusted agents ("vassals") entrust/trust them do it, controlling them themselves. why some recent actions america's close allies, first foremost france, so similar principle distributing feudal lands. probably possible talk about plan kind super empire place sole super power which, basis network principle, would subordinate regional or traditional empires currently acquiring new lease life. centre would same, but now would more like coordinator than straight omnipresent steward; would considerably more economical consequently, or so americans hoping, no less efficient. full sovereignty, meanwhile, including right military intervention, would undoubtedly centred at top pyramid. well-known american academic noam chomsky writes, principles international order lie fact united states has right use violence whenever they like. nobody else has right . "of course not. well, maybe our clients do. so they inherit right. other american clients do, too. but rights really reside washington. that's what means own world. it's like air breathe. can't question it". (2) fact today, new turn history, neofeudal system vassal dependence re-establishing itself world which, its day, replaced mighty rome. today's rome washington, which many ways exactly same state imperial exhaustion, including moral, which reality trying continue its hegemony using exactly same methods, although very latest technology; but really makes no different, only technique there nothing new that. neo-vassalage has lot benefits. firstly, if something going wrong, always possible make seem like one responsible not who really pulling strings, namely washington, but vassal state. using vassal, completely possible deny one's own involvement fates other states pull robes impartial arbitrator. secondly, such mechanism projecting global power also allows costs managing territories kept minimum, which rather important given global financial crisis. at same time, while setting about reorganising world, washington also needs factor costs would bring. at some point, interests main liege lord may not coincide interests large vassals capable obstinacy. furthermore, those against whom game being directed may position set about strengthening their own alliances, contours which already discernible. consequently, while way putting its plan into action, washington still has number complex problems solve.
