content: gold prices slipped tuesday london's wholesale market, falling only fourth time 16 trading days world stock markets, commodities government bond prices all rose yet again. us dollar extended week's rally from 3-month lows currency market, pushing euro down $1.19205, 7-session low. held price wholesale gold investment bars above eur1100 per ounce french, german italian investors, its strongest level nearly 9 weeks. china's yuan also fell against dollar, while shanghai gold premiums - an indicator demand supply inside world's no.1 mining, importing consumer nation - slipped back $7 per ounce above london quotes. only 5 weeks until china's peak lunar new year shopping season, was near weakest incentive new bullion imports since mid-september. "gold could finally break out its four-year trading range if inflation starts lift globally," says new 2018 commodities outlook from former london bullion clearing bank barclays, tipping mining stocks more broadly "compelling [on] strengthening macro backdrop , limited capex, strong earnings momentum...cheap valuation multiples light [investor] positioning." shorter term, "gold should see [support] at recent low $1315 psychological $1300 level below that," reckons swiss refining finance group mks pamp's asian trading desk. "on upside, break above lasts weeks high $1324 could see yellow metal make move september top $1355." september peak "will decisive level larger up trend" agrees french investment bullion market-making bank societe generale's technical analysis team today, calling $1350-1356 level "the neckline" "large inverted head shoulder pattern." major reversal pattern "forms after downtrend," explains stockcharts. "[it] contains three successive troughs middle trough (head) being deepest two outside troughs (shoulders) being shallower. "a clear move above $1356 will mean confirmation formation," says socgen's note, "and will lead next leg up move towards $1433/1485 first." "it quite possible yellow metal could attempt hit $1357 not too distant future," says separate note from canadian brokerage td securities, "[because] investors seem ready take hefty long gold positions even equity markets surging." last week's positioning data comex gold futures options showed sharpest jump speculative bullish betting by money managers, net group's bearish bets, since mid-august. td's bart melek gave best 2017 average gold price forecast industry body lbma's annual competition last year, predicting $1257 per ounce against $1256 out-turn at london's afternoon benchmarking. he now forecasts 4.5% rise gold 2018, predicting an average annual price $1313 per ounce. near term, "a move toward $1375 possible should market believe us central bank will gentle their rate hike signaling," says td's latest note.
title: gold price slips but technical analysts target break above $1355 sept high

content: marxist professors berate attack teacher showing debate about non-gendered pronouns % readers think story fact. add your two cents. headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! two neo-marxist professors at wilfrid laurier university canada were recorded berating young female teaching assistant showing her first-year communications students debate where professor jordan peterson argued against use non-gendered pronouns. teaching assistant lindsay shepherd can heard breaking down into tears her supervising professor nathan rambukkan another professor, herbert pimlott, accuse her creating "toxic" "problematic" environment which constitutes violence against transgendered students. here's audio from national post: full tape: here's some highlights: 00:03:10 "these arguments counter canadian human rights code" rambukkana: ...[peterson] lectures about critiquing feminism, critiquing trans rights -- shepherd: i'm familiar. i follow him. but can shield people from those ideas? am i supposed comfort them make sure they insulated away from this? like, what point is? because me, so against what university about. so against it. i was not taking sides. i was presenting both arguments. rambukkana: so thing about is, if you're presenting something like this, have think about kind teaching climate you're creating. actually, these arguments counter canadian human rights code. even since ... c-16, ever since passed, discriminatory targeting someone due their gender identity or gender expression. by c-16, rambukkana referring recently passed federal bill prohibits discrimination based gender identity or expression. his read dead wrong; it's obviously not violation c-16 screen tvontario program at university. one thing, bill only applies federally-regulated industries, which does not include universities. even if did, legal experts contacted by national post were extremely dubious shepherd's actions constituted anything remotely resembling discrimination. 00:04:22 "it has created toxic climate some students" shepherd:like i said, was spirit debate. rambukkana: okay, "in spirit debate" slightly different than 'this problematic idea we might want unpack.' shepherd: but that's taking sides. rambukkana: yes. shepherd: it's taking sides me like "oh, look at guy, like everything comes out his mouth b.s. but we're going watch anyway." rambukkana: i understand position you're coming from your positionality, but reality has created toxic climate some students, know, it's great -- shepherd: how many? who? how many? one? rambukkana: may i speak? shepherd: i have no concept how many people complained, what their complaint was, haven't shown me complaint. rambukkana: i understand upsetting, but also confidentiality matters. shepherd: number people confidential? rambukkana: yes. he understands her "positionality." these lunatics belong mental institutions, not universities. wilfrid laurier university president vice chancellor deborah maclatchy issued an apology shepherd after story went viral. shepherd questioned maclatchy's sincerity said if she's serious about protecting free speech she should adopt university chicago's policies which say "being offended" or "triggered" "not enough suppress or silence debate." article has been contributed by shtf plan. visit <url> alternative news, commentary preparedness info. source: <url>
title: marxist professors berate attack teacher showing debate about non-gendered pronouns

content: by pam martens russ martens: april 4, 2016 tomorrow senate banking committee, chaired by senator richard shelby since republicans took control senate 2014 midterms, will hold hearing "assessing effects consumer finance regulations." title can easily translated into "how achieve lobbyists' dream wish killing off consumer financial protection bureau its embarrassing ability perpetually show how deregulation financial services industry has led wholesale looting public." senator shelby does not even make pretense presenting balanced slate witnesses at these hearings one has question why ranking member, senator sherrod brown, democrat, not holding shelby's feet fire issue. tomorrow's hearing has three panelists listed: leonard chanin, counsel at morrison foerster - law firm was registered lobbyist american bankers association last year according center responsive politics; david hirschmann, another registered lobbyist ceo u.s. chamber commerce center capital markets competitiveness. u.s. chamber commerce has spent $62 million lobbying congress since 1998 an effort gut or water down regulations wall street other big corporate groups. (for more in-depth understanding what drives u.s. chamber commerce, not confused small business organization your community known chamber commerce, read susan antilla's "chamber commerce gives wall street, polluters what they pay for.") rounding out tomorrow's panel todd zywicki, senior scholar at rabidly anti-regulatory mercatus center law professor at related george mason university. according sourcewatch, mercatus center "was founded funded by koch family foundations," nonprofits set up by koch brothers sluice money into sprawling maze think tanks, corporate front groups, university economic departments. sourcewatch reveals "the koch family has contributed more than thirty million dollars george mason, much which has gone mercatus center." one luminaries mercatus center fame wendy lee gramm, whom mercatus center archives credits setting up its "regulatory studies program" 1999. gramm was also former chair commodity futures trading commission (cftc) from 1988 january 1993, which took hands off approach regulating derivatives: according report from public citizen: "in 1992, first step its business plan profit speculation energy, enron petitioned cftc make regulatory changes would limit scope commission's authority over certain kinds futures contracts. immediately before leaving cftc, gramm muscled through approval an unusual draft regulation would do just - narrowed definition futures contracts excluded enron's energy future contracts swaps from regulatory oversight. although her actions were criticized by government officials who feared change would have severe negative consequences (as, fact, did), gramm was rewarded five weeks after she left cftc lucrative appointment enron's board directors. between 1993 2001, when company declared bankruptcy, enron paid gramm between $915,000 $1.85 million salary, attendance fees, stock option sales, dividends." enron was major campaign contributor wendy lee gramm's husband, former senator phil gramm, whom gramm-leach-bliley act partially named. gramm-leach-bliley legislation signed into law 1999 overturned seminal consumer protection legislation against bank abuses known glass-steagall act. allowed gambling casinos wall street (investment banks brokerage firms) merge commercial banks holding fdic-insured deposits savers use those insured deposits gamble house unregulated derivatives. (see here here how that's worked out.) what was koch brothers' interest deregulating derivatives? unknown most americans, addition its oil, chemical lumber interests, koch industries has sprawling futures trading operation known koch supply & trading. koch web site defines operation thusly: "building four decades trading experience, our capabilities rooted energy products. our metals derivatives trading groups have also expanded beyond trading, logistics operations pioneer use risk-management tools. each our team members has role exchanging some world's most valued commodities." offices financial hubs around world (london, geneva, amsterdam, singapore, dubai) koch supply & trading also offering, through its new york office, "energy metals risk management products corporate clients financial institutions." koch also says its new york office focuses "trading financial instruments across multiple asset classes, including commodities, fixed income foreign exchange." 2014, tim dickinson took an in-depth look rolling stone magazine into "toxic empire" koch brothers, including koch supply & trading. dickinson reports: "like casino bets at its own craps table, koch engages 'proprietary trading' - speculating company's own bottom line. 'we're like hedge fund dealer at same time,' bragged ilia bouchouev, head koch's derivatives trading 2004. 'we can both make markets speculate.' company's many tentacles physical oil business give koch rich insight into market conditions disruptions can inform its speculative bets. when oil prices spiked record heights 2008, koch was major player speculative markets, according documents leaked by vermont sen. bernie sanders, trading volumes rivaling wall street giants like citibank. koch rode trader-driven frenzy - detached from actual supply demand - drove prices above $147 barrel july 2008, battering global economy about enter free fall." wendy gramm's husband, former senator phil gramm, served chair senate banking committee from 1995 2000. his deregulatory legislation blind march drumbeat special interests was blamed by time magazine key contributor financial collapse 2008. americans need their guard senator shelby's tenure chair senate banking committee not heading same direction. ranking member committee, senator sherrod brown, needs use his bully pulpit make certain there balanced testimony at public hearings.
title: shelby's senate banking committee has no pretense fairness
meta_description: by pam martens russ martens: april 4, 2016 senator richard shelby delivering his opening statement at senate banking hearing fed accountability

content: 12-year-old girl dies after doctors misdiagnose her infection flu headline: bitcoin & blockchain searches exceed trump! blockchain stocks next! visalia, california, girl has died after doctors misdiagnosed her bacterial infection flu. alyssa alcaraz was showing some symptoms having flu so many others california coming down virus, doctors they were certain what she had - but they were wrong, now alyssa has died. bacterial infection moved quickly through alyssa's body wasn't discovered until after her death. mariah alcaraz recalls day her sister got sick. "i remember she came home from school she was throwing up i thought oh she's probably got food poisoning she's going ok." but infection was not food poisoning. alyssa's mom says doctors told family her daughter had flu. after few days staying home from school not getting better, they took alyssa back urgent care. when physician realized young girl's oxygen levels were low she was immediately rushed kaweah delta medical center by ambulance. according acb30, within hours, alyssa's organs started shutting down her family says she "coded" (slang referring patient cardiopulmonary arrest) six times. by 2:50 pm sunday afternoon young vibrant girl passion music singing had died. her death certificate says she went into cardiac arrest septic shock from strep blood infection - an infection no one her family knew she had since doctors said she had flu. gofundme account has been set up help family expenses come death. if would like donate alyssa's fund, please click here. our thoughts family alyssa alcaraz during very difficult time. delivered by daily sheeple we encourage share republish our reports, analyses, breaking news videos (click details). contributed by daily sheeple <url> content may freely reproduced full or part digital form full attribution author link <url> source: <url>

were grown contain human feces. bc oysters norovirus: hundreds cases months an "r" british columbia medical journal, vol. 59, no. 6, july, august 2017, page(s) 326,327 bc centre disease control lorraine mcintyre, msc, eleni galanis, md, mph, frcpc, natalie prystajecky, phd, tom kosatsky, md between november 2016 march 2017 more than 400 individuals across canada developed norovirus gastroenteritis associated consumption bc oysters. over 100 cases occurred mid-november participants at tofino oyster festival. six cases occurred persons attending december oyster barbecue victoria. by march over 300 additional cases norovirus linked cultivated bc oysters harvested from multiple sites both east west coasts vancouver island were identified bc, alberta, ontario consumers. norovirus highly infectious cause gastroenteritis typically spread from person person associated regular community outbreaks schools, hospitals, day cares, care facilities. foodborne outbreaks norovirus often linked ill food handlers. recent outbreak, oysters were contaminated marine environment where they were farmed. trace-back oysters consumed by infected individuals led closure 13 geographically dispersed marine farms bc (see map) extensive public outreach. genotypic analysis norovirus isolated from cases included several variants genogroup i (gi) early outbreak both genogroups gi gii later outbreak. both gi gii norovirus were detected oysters from shellfish farms. suggests oysters bind act reservoir community outbreak strains disseminate those strains consumers.[1] although sewage often cause oyster contamination remains unclear whether one or many sewage sources contributed contamination shellfish farms. 2016-17 outbreak was preceded by wet fall accompanied an unseasonably cold winter. wet, cold, dark winters enhance norovirus survival, allowing longer retention ocean sediments oysters.[2,3] infective dose norovirus estimated few 18 particles.[2] given low infective dose viability norovirus cold water, we postulate sewage spread by ocean currents may have contaminated geographically dispersed farms. among potential sources under investigation sewer overflows, metropolitan local wastewater treatment plants, municipal raw sewage discharge, commercial fishing vessels. bccdc leading collaborative group reviewing pollution sources discharging bc marine environments may have contaminated bc oysters. outbreak, both raw cooked oysters led illness; oysters were likely insufficiently cooked inactivate norovirus. addition norovirus, pathogens like vibrio sp., salmonella sp., hepatitis can transmitted oyster consumers; cooking oysters an internal temperature 90 degc at least 90 seconds will reduce risk. "rule" shellfish safe eat months an "r" (september april) false. first, bacteria viruses persist cold seawater. second, marine biotoxins (saxitoxin domoic acid cause paralytic amnesic shellfish poisoning) occur year round. physicians laboratories play an important role controlling foodborne disease. outbreak, trace-back oysters linked cases was used close shellfish farms. if see patients acute gastroenteritis who recently consumed shellfish, inform your local public health office submit stool samples testing.[4] authors acknowledge partners national outbreak investigation environmental transmission norovirus working group. rajko-nenow p, waters a, keaveney s, et al. norovirus genotypes present oysters effluent from wastewater treatment plant during seasonal peak infections ireland 2010. appl environ microbiol 2013;79: 2578-2587. campos cja, lees dn. environmental transmission human noroviruses shellfish waters. appl environ microbiol 2014;80:3552-3561. hassard f, gwyther cl, farkas k, et al. abundance distribution enteric bacteria viruses coastal estuarine sediments--a review. front microbiol 2016;(7):article 1692. guidelines protocols advisory committee. infectious diarrhea - guideline ordering stool specimens. accessed 18 march 2017. www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/health/practitioner-professional-resources/bc-guidelines/infectious-diarrhea. republished permission from bill marler marler clark. copyright (c) marler clark llp, ps. all rights reserved. source: <url>

content: trump's decision sell advanced lethal weapons systems neo-nazi ukrainian regime could easily spiral into dangerous, self-made, geopolitical crisis jay syrmopoulos last week, trump administration, reversed its previous position announced they had agreed supply advanced lethal defensive weapons ukrainian government -- including likely delivery javelin anti-tank weapons -- which could decimate russian armor. move sure seen moscow drastic escalation will almost certainly precipitate russian retaliation. russian officials denounced president trump's authorization lethal equipment ukrainians an aggressive act meant deliberately sabotage minsk peace process. "the united states has crossed line by announcing its intention supply lethal weapons ukraine," russian deputy foreign minister sergei ryabkov said saturday. "u.s. weapons capable leading new casualties our neighboring country, we cannot remain indifferent that." decision was framed by state department one assisting ukraine fight back against russian "aggression" was lauded by congressional war hawks necessary step confront what many neocons cold war relics see an expansionist russian foreign policy. state department spokeswoman heather nauert said weapons were, "part our effort help ukraine build its long-term defense capacity, defend its sovereignty territorial integrity, deter further aggression." proponents sending ukrainian government advanced us weapons believe if they can exact harsh enough death toll russian soldiers assisting separatists donbas, will force putin withdraw support separatists. insane logic being employed by west shows little understanding psychology russian president vladimir putin. simply wishful thinking believe war attrition, border russia, will force putin retreat. instead, will precipitate drastic escalation russian support. one need simply analyze past few years war eastern ukraine clearly see moscow willing take undertake whatever economic, political or military consequences necessary prevent defeat anti-kiev separatists donbas. 2014 2015, when ukrainian soldiers pro-government neo-nazi battalions were engaging ukrainian separatists fierce door-to-door, house-to-house fighting, russia didn't back down - instead, they escalated forcefully stepped up support - they supplied not only personnel, but tanks, supplies, reinforcements stop kiev's advances. according daniel depetris, fellow at defense priorities, washington, d.c. thinktank: putin's mind, allowing ukraine retake strategic territory was an unthinkable prospect would lead kiev believe could squash rebellion militarily. infusion russian troops stopped ukrainian territorial advances their tracks, at considerable human cost kiev. other words, whenever pro-russian militants were losing ground or at risk, moscow turned spigot assistance prevent humiliating defeat or retreat. one biggest reminders world community ukraine's political disposition ultimately far more important russia's strategic interests than washington's. no amount u.s. military equipment or heavy weapons systems likely eclipse what russians will provide other side. believe russia will intimidated into withdrawing its troops from ukrainian territory or suing peace government moscow sees puppet west just because few more its soldiers have been killed place hope over reality putin's track record throughout war. whether we united states or western europe accept legitimate or not, putin highly motivated preserve russian influence freedom movement country shares 1,426-mile border russian federation. allow ukraine drift fully into europe's orbit his watch would nothing short personal political humiliation putin and, more important, geopolitical catastrophe russia whose political elites remain incredibly nervous about shrinking near abroad any hint political revolution former soviet space. decision provide advanced lethal weaponry ukraine will used by moscow an excuse increase its support ukrainian proxies breakaway republics donetsk luhansk. russian government has operated virtual lockstep proxy forces since western coup depose then ukrainian president viktor yanukovych. although made look like spontaneous revolution people ukraine, further study wake euromaidan revealed plethora oligarchic forces called fatherland, neo-nazi ukrainian nationalists, shadowy intelligence forces operating concert western intelligence agencies create perfect storm "popular revolution" ukraine. what appeared face popular uprising was, reality, nothing more than well-scripted coup attempt meant install pro-western government ukraine. eastern regions ukraine, large russian speaking populations, refused recognize illegitimate government requested federalization maintain semblance autonomy from pro-western regime took power. however, new pro-west government refused instead sent military forces occupy region. precipitated local resistance russian assistance local ukrainian forces fighting defend their home from newly installed regime kiev. president trump's choice deepen u.s. engagement conflict involves non-nato country whose political positioning largely irrelevant u.s. policy europe bad decision has frightening implications regarding increased potential conflict another nuclear superpower. an article breaking defense , depetris posited numerous, compelling, unanswered questions reveal extremely shortsighted nature trump administration's decision: what, instance, u.s. objective ukraine other than simply trying bleed russians proxy conflict? when -- not if -- russia escalates, what would trump administration do counter it? how far u.s. willing go frustrate moscow's ambitions country sees an extension its former soviet glory? what if putin, his desire respond what he regards american aggression his own backyard, seeks expand conflict by stirring up pro-moscow sentiment among russian-speaking populations baltics? what would nato do situation? nato even prepared such contingency? if they not, how any other eastern european nation supposed have any confidence nato when transatlantic alliance can't even defend its own members? dmitri trenin, director carnegie moscow center, commented twitter: provision us lethal arms ukraine will change little battlefield, but marks washington's deeper more direct involvement conflict. an important line has been crossed, probably won't stop there.
title: trump now arming ukrainian neo-nazi regime - expect russia retaliate & escalate
meta_description: what, instance, u.s. objective ukraine other than simply trying bleed russians proxy conflict? when -- not if -- russia escalates, what would trump administration do counter it?

content: department justice has decided review again hillary clinton's use private email server her handling classified information while secretary state, daily beast reporting. focus new examination, according daily beast: how much classified information passed through clinton's private server? who transferred information into an unclassified area, how? which investigators knew about issues when? what, if any, immunity agreements clinton aides struck? decision reopen scrutiny into clinton's emails comes aftermath president donald trump accusing his own law enforcement agency being part deep state not investigating reported mishandling classified info by former top clinton aide huma abedin. crooked hillary clinton's top aid, huma abedin, has been accused disregarding basic security protocols. she put classified passwords into hands foreign agents. remember sailors pictures submarine? jail! deep state justice dept must finally act? also comey & others -- donald j. trump (@realdonaldtrump) january 2, 2018 trump, course, has constantly beaten drum attorney general jeff sessions reopen an investigation into clinton. many people our country asking what "justice" department going do about fact totally crooked hillary, after receiving subpoena from united states congress, deleted "acid washed" 33,000 emails? no justice! -- donald j. trump (@realdonaldtrump) december 3, 2017 "people should encouraged new leadership at justice department actually interested nonpartisan, above-board justice department treats every citizen equally," mark corallo, former doj spokesman george w. bush administration, told daily beast. "it's about time they're doing review whole mess," corallo said. predictable retort from clinton's side. "the justice department should not opening itself up perception bending political pressures from white house," former clinton campaign spokesman brian fallon told daily beast. "the justice department supposed operate independently white house, even if just perfunctory step they're taking try appease president, itself an abuse doj authority," fallon said.
title: daily beast: doj taking fresh look into hillary's emails

content: democratic national committee chairman tom perez ripped president donald trump's move end protected status about 200,000 immigrants from el salvador, hill reported. he called trump's decision "cruel heartless." his comments came monday after trump decided end temporary protect status immigrants. move will force them try obtain new legal status or leave u.s. by september 2019, according website. washington post noted salvadorans were granted protected status after earthquakes hit their nation 2001. their permits had been renewed every 18-months, according newspaper. "this cruel heartless decision by cruel heartless president," perez said. "by targeting those who were driven from their homes by environmental catastrophe violence el salvador, donald trump tearing more working families apart -- putting their lives at risk, threatening our economy, turning his back values have made america great. "america great when we respond humanitarian crises by helping those need, not banishing them from our borders." he reiterated his comments twitter.
title: dnc's tom perez: trump 'cruel, heartless' ending protections salvadorans
meta_description: democratic national committee chairman tom perez ripped president donald trump's move end protected status about 200,000 immigrants from el salvador, hill reported.

content: senate minority leader chuck schumer, d-n.y., said president donald trump will get blame if government forced shut down because fight over funds border wall, hill reported. "if president goes down path insists wall or shut down government, which he said back september, make no mistake about it, government shutdown will fall entirely, entirely his shoulders," he said tuesday. hill noted trump has demanded his proposed wall along mexican border included any immigration deal. democrats seeking replacement deferred action childhood arrivals program. trump had announced last year he was ending program, which protects immigrants brought u.s. kids from being deported, website said. but president gave congress time come up replacement. hill reported wall has emerged biggest obstacle getting government funding bill passed. congressional lawmakers have until jan. 19 prevent shutdown. "president trump fighting an empty symbol rather than smart policy will actually produce better security at our borders," schumer said. "a medieval wall can't see through across length southern border will not make us any safer." trump asking $18 billion build repair about 700 miles border structures. twitter, schumer noted money could used hire more customs border protection agents upgrade surveillance along border. he also posted video reminding people trump had promised mexico was paying wall.
title: schumer: trump will blamed any govt shutdown

content: former cia director michael hayden said thursday "we all collectively should little bit frightened" by donald trump reported remarks about immigrants from certain "s**thole countries." "we all collectively should bit embarrassed," hayden, who also directed nsa, told erin burnett an interview cnn. "we all collectively should bit ashamed -- and, frankly, erin, i think we all collectively should little bit frightened. "that's president united states," hayden said. "he not appealing better angels our nature or our nation's values." washington post reported thursday president trump grew frustrated bipartisan meeting immigration lawmakers floated idea restoring protections immigrants from africa, el salvador, haiti. "why we having all these people from s**thole countries come here?" trump asked, according post, referring african countries haiti. newspaper cited two unnamed sources who were briefed meeting its report. hayden declined "make personal judgment president" but called his comments "totally inappropriate." "i don't know any other example recent american history -- we have muddled past -- but recent history where president says something environment where . . . he knew would become public."
title: michael hayden: we should 'frightened' by trump's remarks
